Kitchen utensils like knives, spoons, forks, and stationery items like pencil sharpeners, maps, globes and electrical appliances such as LED lights and fixtures will also get costlier.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Saudi Arabia doubled Russian oil imports in Q2, freeing up own oil for exports: Report
text: The world's largest oil exporter, Saudi Arabia, more than doubled its Russian oil imports in the second quarter, enabling it to free up its own crude for export, as per data accessed by Reuters. It imported 6,47,000 tonnes of Russian oil from April to June. Russia has been selling fuel at discounted prices amid Western sanctions over the Ukraine war.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Sunak praises father-in-law Narayana Murthy, says 'His firm employs thousands in UK'
text: One of the frontrunners for the UK PM's post, Rishi Sunak, said he is proud of what his parents-in-law built. Speaking about Infosys Founder NR Narayana Murthy, Sunak said, "My father-in-law came from...nothing and just had a dream and a couple of hundred pounds [from my] mother-in-law's savings…He...built one of the world's largest...companies that...employs thousands of people...in the UK."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: New Zealand inflation surges to 7.3%, highest since 1990
text: Inflation in New Zealand has surged at its fastest pace in over three decades. As per official data, the Consumer Price Index increased 7.3% in the second quarter, up from 6.9% in the first quarter and the fastest since the June quarter of 1990 when prices rose 7.6%. Economists had predicted that inflation would come in at 7% or 7.1%.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation's half resources have come from Warren: Bill Gates
text: In a blog, Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates said that though the foundation is named Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, "half of its resources to date have come from Warren Buffett's gifts". Gates wrote, "Since 2006, Warren has gifted the foundation $35.7 billion, including his most recent gift of $3.1 billion in June."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Pakistani rupee falls to all-time low of 212 against US dollar
text: The Pakistani rupee has dropped to a record low against the US dollar with the exchange rate sliding to PKR 212, local media reported on Monday. This fall in the value came after traders resorted to panic buying on reports that some commercial banks had run out of foreign currency, reports stated.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: What goods & services get cheaper as new GST rates come into effect today?
text: Electric vehicles, whether or not fitted with a battery pack, will be eligible for the concessional GST rate of 5% from July 18. GST on renting trucks, and goods carriages (where the cost of fuel is included) will be cut to 12% from 18%. GST on ostomy appliances and orthopaedic equipment like splints will be reduced from 12% to 5%.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Plea to stop SpiceJet's operations amid recent mishaps dismissed by Delhi HC
text: The Delhi High Court dismissed a plea seeking to stop the operations of SpiceJet over recent technical snags. The plea cited several incidents involving SpiceJet flights and claimed that passengers' lives are at risk due to their improper management. The DGCA has taken note of incidents involving SpiceJet flights and is free to proceed on its own, the court noted.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: SEBI clears appointment of BSE chief Ashish Chauhan as new NSE CEO & MD
text: The Securities and Exchange Board of India has approved the appointment of Ashish Kumar Chauhan as the new MD and CEO of the NSE. Chauhan is currently the MD and CEO of the BSE and will replace Vikram Limaye whose term ended as NSE chief on July 16. The appointment is subject to Chauhan accepting the offer.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: No GST on pre-packed, labelled food items weighing over 25 kg: Finance Ministry
text: The Finance Ministry has clarified that single packages of pre-packed and labelled food items like cereals and pulses weighing over 25 kg are exempt from 5% GST. It added that if a retail shopkeeper supplies an item in a loose quantity that was bought in a 25-kg pack from a manufacturer, its sale to the consumer will not attract GST.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: HUL, ITC, United Spirits added 130 execs to crorepati club last fiscal: Report
text: Hindustan Unilever (HUL), ITC and United Spirits together added over 130 executives to the club of those earning more than ₹1 crore annually during the last fiscal, The Economic Times reported. United Spirits witnessed a massive jump of 113%, whereas HUL and ITC saw 33% and 44% increase in the number of eight-figure salary earners, as per their annual reports.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Fortune cooking oil prices cut by up to ₹30 per litre by Adani Wilmar
text: Prices of one of the most popular Indian edible oil brands Fortune have been cut by up to ₹30 per litre amid a fall in global prices. This is the second oil price reduction announced by the brand's maker Adani Wilmar in two months. Prices of soyabean and sunflower oils have been cut to ₹165 and ₹195 per litre, respectively.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Hyd authority's one-time scheme offers 90% waiver on property tax arrears
text: The Telangana government has announced a one-time scheme (OTS) for clearing pending property tax arrears within Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) limits and all other urban local bodies. The scheme will allow a waiver of 90% on interest payment, provided that the principal amount plus 10% of interest on accumulated arrears is paid in one go for financial year 2021-22.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Scindia chairs meet with heads of airline companies on safety issues
text: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia chaired a one-on-one meeting with heads of airline companies on Monday to review flight safety norms. The Aviation Ministry also issued instructions to each airline to take steps at all levels to enhance security surveillance. These steps come after a few Indian airlines reported back-to-back incidents of emergency landings due to technical issues.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: 6 of top 10 most valued firms lost ₹1.68 lakh crore in m-cap last week
text: Among the 10 most valued firms, six companies suffered a combined loss of ₹1.68 lakh crore in their market valuation last week. While TCS took the biggest hit as its market valuation declined by ₹99,270.07 crore to reach ₹10,95,355.32 crore, it was followed by Infosys, whose valuation dropped by ₹35,133.64 crore to ₹6,01,900.14 crore.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Swedish fashion retailer H&M to exit Russia amid Ukraine war
text: Swedish fashion retailer H&M said that it will exit from Russia after pausing sales there in March after Moscow's invasion of Ukraine. "After careful consideration, we see it as impossible given the current situation to continue our business in Russia," Chief Executive Helena Helmersson said in a statement. H&M said the move will cost $200 million and affect 6,000 staff.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: You all call me fugitive, which court has ever convicted me: Lalit Modi
text: Lalit Modi on Sunday took to Instagram to speak about various issues after he revealed his relationship with Sushmita Sen. He wrote, "[Though you all] call me a "fugitive"...tell me which court has ever convicted me...None…Everyone knows how difficult it is to do business in India." Speaking about IPL, he said, “Everyone...knows that I did it all alone"
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: World's biggest NFT marketplace OpenSea fires 20% staff citing 'crypto winter'
text: The world's first and biggest NFT marketplace OpenSea has fired 20% of its employees citing "cryptocurrency winter" and "broad macroeconomic instability". CEO Devin Finzer shared the news on Twitter and said the affected employees will be provided with a generous severance and healthcare coverage into 2023. He added that the company will also help in the placement of these employees.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Unjustifiable request: Musk files motion against Twitter's bid to fast-track trial
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has filed a motion opposing Twitter's request to fast-track a trial over the $44 billion deal, terming it an "unjustifiable request". While Twitter has requested the trial begin in September because the merger agreement with Musk terminates on October 25, Musk has requested a trial date on or after February 13, 2023.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Amazon pauses work on 6 new US office buildings to redesign for hybrid work
text: Amazon is pausing construction of six new office buildings in Bellevue and Nashville as it seeks to redesign workspaces for hybrid work. "We want to make sure that we design them in a way that meets our employees' needs in future," Amazon said. Amazon's plan to create 30,000 jobs in Bellevue and Nashville won't be affected by the construction pause.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Like all firms, we are not immune to economic headwinds: Google CEO to staff
text: In an internal memo to the staff, Google CEO Sundar Pichai while announcing the company’s plan to slow its hiring, said, "Like all companies, we’re not immune to economic headwinds". He added, “The uncertain global economic outlook has been top of mind...We’ve never viewed these types of challenges as obstacles. Instead, we’ve seen them as opportunities to deepen our focus."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Google to slow hiring for rest of the year: CEO Pichai tells employees
text: Google CEO Sundar Pichai in an internal memo to the staff has announced that they will be "slowing down the pace of hiring for the rest of the year" amid an uncertain global economic outlook. He added, Google will focus on hiring for "critical roles" and will be "pausing development" in some cases and "re-deploying resources to higher priority areas".
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Will prove our position in court & we believe we'll prevail: Twitter CEO to staff
text: Following a lawsuit against Tesla CEO Elon Musk over the $44 billion acquisition agreement, Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal told his staff, "We will prove our position in court and we believe we will prevail." Twitter's lawsuit has accused Musk of "a long list" of violations of the merger agreement that "cast a pall over Twitter and its business".
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Twitter's sudden speed for trial after 2 months of foot-dragging is a tactic: Musk
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has opposed Twitter's request for a fast-track trial over the $44 billion deal termination. In a filing, Musk said, "Twitter's sudden request for warp speed after two months of foot-dragging...is its latest tactic to shroud the truth about spam accounts long enough to railroad defendants into closing." Twitter has requested that the trial begin in September.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Musk accused lawyers of causing trouble by seeking deal's financing info: Twitter
text: In its lawsuit against Tesla CEO Elon Musk, Twitter has shared a purported image of a text message that Musk sent to CEO Parag Agrawal before terminating the deal. Musk's message read, "Your lawyers are using these conversations to cause trouble….That needs to stop." Musk's message was in response to the company seeking information regarding the deal's financing.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Twitter's lawsuit against Musk gets 90-min 1st court hearing on July 19
text: Twitter’s lawsuit against Tesla CEO Elon Musk over terminating the $44 billion acquisition deal will be first heard in court on July 19. Kathaleen McCormick, the Chancellor of Delaware's Court of Chancery, has set a 90-minute hearing. Notably, Twitter has requested that the trial begins in September because the merger agreement with Musk terminates on October 25.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Withdraw GST on healthcare services: IMA writes letter to Finance Minister
text: The Indian Medical Association (IMA) has written a letter to Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman requesting to exempt healthcare services from GST. Citing various recommendations by the 47th GST Council on certain facilities that were earlier exempted from GST and will be taxed post-July 18, IMA said the cost "will add a significant additional cost to the healthcare of people."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Twitter-Musk case to be overseen by Delaware business court's 1st female chief judge
text: The first female chief judge on Delaware’s business court will oversee Twitter’s lawsuit against Tesla CEO Elon Musk for violating the $44 billion acquisition agreement. Kathaleen McCormick took over the role of chancellor, or chief judge, last year. McCormick's final ruling on the merger can be appealed to the Delaware Supreme Court.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Sula Vineyards to go public, files IPO papers with SEBI
text: Nashik-based Sula Vineyards has filed draft papers with the Securities and Exchange Board of India to raise capital through an IPO. The IPO will be entirely an offer for sale (OFS) with up to 25,546,186 equity shares put up for sale. The company has not finalised the date or price of the IPO as yet.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Jet fuel prices cut by 2.2%; second reduction this year
text: Aviation Turbine Fuel prices were reduced by 2.2% on Saturday, reflecting a fall in international oil prices. The prices were cut by ₹3,084.94 per kilolitre to ₹1,38,147.93/kl. This is only the second reduction in rates this year. Prices had peaked at ₹1,41,232.87/kl last month. Overall, ATF rates have been hiked 11 times since the start of this year.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Who are the highest-paid FMCG CEOs in India in FY22?
text: Marico’s MD and CEO Saugata Gupta emerged as the highest-paid FMCG CEO as his total pay in FY22 jumped by 157% from ₹14.03 crore in FY21 to ₹36.1 crore in FY22. Gupta is followed by HUL's Sanjiv Mehta at ₹22 crore salary, Nestle's Suresh Narayanan (₹18.80 crore), Dabur India's Mohit Malhotra (₹14.60 crore) and ITC's Sanjiv Puri (₹12.59 crore).
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: IndiGo not following maintenance procedures, technicians tell Airbus; airline replies
text: IndiGo's technicians have written a letter to aircraft manufacturer Airbus complaining that the airline is not following standard maintenance procedures leading to risking passengers' safety. They said the technical staff has been on a strike for a couple of days and the airline is operating flights without proper maintenance. Meanwhile, IndiGo denied the allegations, calling them "baseless".
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Celsius becomes 3rd major crypto firm to file for bankruptcy in 3 weeks
text: Celsius has become the third major crypto firm to file for bankruptcy in three weeks following the collapse of hedge fund Three Arrows Capital and broker Voyager Digital. The crypto lender said the decision was part of a financial restructuring that would "stabilise the business". The US-based platform had suspended customer withdrawals, swaps and transfers citing "extreme market conditions".
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Crypto must come under auto info-exchange mechanism: FM Sitharaman to G20
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman told the group of 20 major economies to consider bringing cryptocurrencies under the ambit of the automatic exchange of information mechanism. The mechanism exists among countries to curb tax evasion. She said that investigations have shown tax evaders resorting to numerous layers of entities to mask their unaccounted wealth.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Almost all states prepared draft rules on labour codes: Bhupender Yadav
text: Union Minister Bhupender Yadav has said that almost all Indian states have prepared draft rules on the four labour codes. "Almost all states have finalised draft rules...We will implement the codes [in one go] at an appropriate time," Yadav said. He added that there are a few Northeastern states, including Meghalaya, which have not completed the process yet.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: RBI likely to introduce new rules for fintech firms: Report
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is likely to announce new regulations for fintech companies, Moneycontrol reported. The rules will likely cover areas such as data sharing, privacy, compliance with KYC and anti-money laundering norms, the report said. This comes in the wake of complaints related to some fintechs charging usurious interest rates and other issues, the report added.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Chinese economy shrinks by 2.6% in Apr-Jun quarter
text: The Chinese economy shrank by 2.6% in the April-June quarter this year, as experts forecasted Beijing missing its 5.5% growth target for this financial year. This is China's weakest quarterly growth since the beginning of the pandemic. The April-June quarter was marked by the lockdowns in Shanghai and other cities as China fought to contain the coronavirus outbreak.
author: Indraneel Sen

headlines: States' fiscal deficit may rise to ₹8.4 lakh cr due to high capex: ICRA
text: States' fiscal deficit may rise to ₹8.4 lakh crore as they've budgeted 36% higher capital expenditure during 2022-23, an ICRA report said. As many as 26 large states, except Assam, have spent ₹5 lakh crore in capex, a 34% rise from FY20, it added. In budget estimates, these states have pegged their revenue receipts at ₹35.8 lakh crore.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Federal Bank's profit jumps 63% y-o-y to ₹600 crore, share price rises
text: The share price of private sector lender Federal Bank rose by 1.54% to ₹98.80 after it reported a 63.5% increase in net profit in the April-June quarter to ₹600.66 crore. The bank had reported a profit of ₹367 crore in the same period last year. Meanwhile, its net interest income rose by 13% to ₹1,604.5 crore.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Attach bank accounts of person in Shree Ramkrishna Electro case: SEBI
text: SEBI has ordered the attachment of bank accounts along with share and mutual fund holdings of an individual to recover about ₹18 crore in the Shree Ramkrishna Electro Controls case. The recovery proceedings have been ordered against Chandrakant Bhargav Gole to recover ₹5.74 crore collected by the company along with ₹12.53 crore at 15% interest per annum.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Adani Ports to buy Israel's Haifa Port with local firm for $1.18 bn
text: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone have won a bid to acquire Israel's Haifa Port with local firm Gadot Group for $1.18 billion, Israel announced on Thursday. Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone will have a 70% stake and Gadot will hold the remaining 30%. Adani Ports said the acquisition will boost trade lanes with its Indian ports.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: RBI's new settlement system unlikely to be used widely: Capital Economics
text: The Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) new system for settling international trade in rupees is unlikely to be used widely, Capital Economics said. Assistant Economist Adam Hoyes said that most global trade is settled in dollars because settling it in alternative currencies is usually more expensive. The depth and liquidity of dollar markets make dollars a cheaper option, he added.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: India's long-term growth prospects embedded in public capex programmes: FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said India's long-term growth prospects are embedded in public capital expenditure programmes. Speaking at the third G20 Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governors meeting in Bali, she added that evidence-based policy making is vital for resilient economic systems. She had raised capital expenditure by 35.4% for 2022-23 to ₹7.5 lakh crore to boost demand.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Twitter sues Elon Musk for backing out of $44 billion deal
text: Twitter has sued Elon Musk for violating his $44 billion deal to buy the social media platform. "Musk apparently believes that he...is free to change his mind, trash the company...and walk away," said the lawsuit. Musk said he was terminating the deal because Twitter violated the agreement by failing to respond to requests for information regarding fake or spam accounts.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Delhi HC allows Vivo to operate bank accounts if it furnishes bank guarantee of ₹950 cr
text: The Delhi High Court has allowed Chinese smartphone manufacturer Vivo to operate its bank accounts if it furnishes a bank guarantee of ₹950 crore. The court has also directed Vivo to maintain ₹250 crore in its accounts. Vivo India on Friday approached the court challenging the freezing of its bank accounts by ED in connection with a money laundering case.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: 'Oh the irony lol' tweets Elon Musk after Twitter sues him
text: Minutes after news surfaced that Twitter has sued him for breaching the $44 billion contract, Tesla CEO Elon Musk took to the microblogging site and tweeted, "Oh the irony lol". As per The Verge, the lawsuit was filed in Delaware's Court of Chancery, accusing Musk of hypocrisy. Twitter is represented by M&A law firm Wachtell, Lipton, Rosen & Katz.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: DRI detects customs duty evasion of ₹4,389 crore by Oppo India
text: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) has detected customs duty evasion of nearly ₹4,389 crore by Oppo India. Searches were conducted by DRI at office of Oppo India and residences of its key management employees. This led to the recovery of incriminating evidence indicating wilful mis-declaration in the description of certain items imported by Oppo India.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Rupee edges closer to 80 per US dollar, opens at record low of 79.94
text: The rupee on Friday opened at a record low of 79.94 against the US dollar. So far this year, the US dollar is up 7% against the Indian currency. On Thursday, the currency had closed at another record low of 79.90 against the US dollar. Meanwhile, BSE Sensex jumped 316 points to 53,733 in Friday's early session.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Euro falls below $1 for the first time in nearly 20 years
text: The euro dropped below parity against the US dollar on Wednesday for the first time in almost 20 years. Euro was trading at around $0.998 at 12:45 pm GMT, down 0.4% in 24 hours, marking its lowest level since December 2002, Reuters reported. The euro has lost more than 10% so far this year.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Rupee closes at all-time low of 79.60 against US dollar
text: The Indian rupee ended at a record low of 79.60 (provisional) against the US dollar on Tuesday. The currency witnessed an intra-day high of 79.53 and a low of 79.66 against the US dollar in Tuesday’s trade. Meanwhile, the euro reached parity with the US dollar for the first time in 20 years on Tuesday.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Rupee hits new lifetime low of 79.67 per US dollar
text: The Indian rupee hit a new record low of 79.67 for a third straight session on Wednesday. In the previous session, the rupee had collapsed to close at 79.60 against the dollar. "There is a general risk-off sentiment. Until flows come back, we will see the dollar being bid against currencies like ours," a senior trader told Reuters.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Rupee drops 9 paise to close at all-time low of 79.90 against US dollar
text: The rupee declined by 9 paise to close at a new record low of 79.90 against the US dollar on Thursday. At the interbank foreign exchange market, the local currency opened at 79.72 and witnessed intra-day high of 79.71 and a low of 79.92 against the US dollar. Meanwhile, brent crude futures, the global oil benchmark, dropped 2.20% to $97.38/barrel.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Elon has a real record of success: LinkedIn Co-founder defends Musk against Trump
text: LinkedIn's billionaire Co-founder Reid Hoffman defended Tesla CEO Elon Musk after former US President Donald Trump called the former a "bullshit artist" over the $44 billion Twitter deal. Hoffman tweeted, "Elon's a classic American immigrant story- an entrepreneur with a real record of success…[Whereas] Trump is a spoiled rich kid who bankrupts everything he touches. Including the US economy."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Twitter uses Musk's old poop reaction to CEO's tweet as evidence in court, he reacts
text: Twitter has used Tesla CEO Elon Musk's poop reaction to one of CEO Parag Agrawal's tweets on spam accounts in May as evidence against him in court. The Twitter lawsuit alleged that Musk has repeatedly disparaged Twitter and created business risk for the company. Meanwhile, reacting to this, Musk used another poop emoji and wrote, "= bs".
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: No plans for company-wide layoffs: Twitter amid lawsuit against Musk
text: In a filing, Twitter has said that it isn't looking at company-wide layoffs but could continue to restructure the business. The filing comes a day after it sued Tesla CEO Elon Musk for violating his $44 billion deal. In May, Twitter said it would pause hiring and review all existing job offers to determine whether any "should be pulled back".
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: 550 women sue Uber in US, say they were 'raped, harassed' by drivers; firm responds
text: Uber has been sued in the US by 550 women who claimed they "were kidnapped, sexually assaulted, sexually battered, raped, stalked, harassed, or otherwise attacked by Uber drivers". "Sexual assault is a horrific crime and we take every single report seriously," an Uber spokesperson said. "There is nothing more important than safety," the spokesperson further said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: US inflation hits new 4-decade high of 9.1% in June
text: The consumer price index (CPI) in the US jumped in June 2022 at its fastest year-over-year pace since the end of 1981, the US Bureau of Labor Statistics reported. Inflation rose 9.1% in June 2022 from the same month a year ago. Excluding food and energy, the core CPI rose 5.9%, compared with the 5.7% estimate.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: ED arrests former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna, gets 4-day remand in money laundering case
text: The ED arrested former CEO and MD of NSE Chitra Ramkrishna in a money laundering case and got a four-day remand. The ED filed the case in connection with the illegal phone tapping case and the snooping case of employees of the stock exchange. In March, Chitra was arrested by CBI in connection with the NSE co-location case in Delhi.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Moved to UK overnight: Agarwal on how he became 1st Indian to list firm in London market
text:
Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal posted an old picture and shared how he became the first Indian
to list his firm on the London Stock Exchange in 2003. He wrote, "My wife...thought I was crazy when I told her that we are moving to London overnight...I didn't have much when I arrived...but had...the...blessings of my margdarshak (guide)- my parents."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: I'll eventually be out of the list of world's richest people: Gates on donation plans
text: Bill Gates has said, "As I look to the future, my plan is to give all my wealth to the Gates Foundation other than what I spend on myself and my family." "I do some...investing in US health care issues...outside the foundation," he added. "I'll move down and eventually off of the list of the world's richest people," he stated.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: HCL Tech Q1 profit rises 2.11% to ₹3,281 crore, company declares ₹10 dividend
text: HCL Technologies on Tuesday reported a consolidated net profit of ₹3,281 crore in the June quarter, up 2.11% from ₹3,213 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. The company's consolidated revenue increased by 16.92% to ₹23,464 crore as against ₹20,068 crore reported in the year-ago period. The company has declared a dividend of ₹10 per share.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Govt will raise funds from capital market for road projects: Gadkari
text: Union Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said on Tuesday that the government will raise funds from capital markets for road projects. "I don't want to use the finances of rich people. I'm going to share market, and...I'm going to take investments from small people," he said. The construction equipment industry is facing problems due to rising crude oil prices, he added.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: India's sugar, onion exports affected due to Sri Lankan crisis: Report
text: The ongoing economic crisis in Sri Lanka has affected the Indian exports of sugar and onion, said a report. Of the 40,000-50,000 tonnes of sugar which Sri Lanka consumes every month, 90% is sourced from India, the report stated. The Indian exporters have stopped sending onions there and the exporters who had traded are yet to receive payments, it said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Hotel industry revenues to return to pre-COVID levels in FY23: ICRA
text: The hotel industry's revenues and margins are expected to return to pre-COVID levels in FY23, ratings agency ICRA said. Demand will be mainly driven by domestic leisure and transient travel, although there will be a gradual recovery in business travel and foreign tourist arrivals, ICRA said. Pan-India premium hotel occupancy is expected to be at 68-70% for FY23, it added.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: German auto components firm Bosch to invest over ₹200 crore in India
text: German auto components firm Bosch will invest ₹200 crore in India over next five years in advanced automotive technologies and digital mobility space, Managing Director Soumitra Bhattacharya said. The company is also "quietly and cautiously" optimistic about having double-digit growth in FY2022-23 over the previous fiscal, he added. In 2021-22, Bosch recorded a profit after tax of ₹1,217 crore.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: IndiGo starts disciplinary proceedings after mass sick leaves: Report
text: IndiGo has started disciplinary proceedings against aeroplane maintenance technicians who went on mass sick leave for five days, PTI reported. The airline has asked concerned technicians to come in and see the airline doctor along with any appropriate medical records so the company can confirm they were genuinely ill, the report said. The technicians took leave to protest inadequate pay.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: CBI may question senior journalist in NSE phone tapping case: Report
text: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) is likely to question a senior journalist in Mumbai in connection with the alleged phone tapping of National Stock Exchange (NSE) employees, Moneycontrol reported. CBI found the journalist had introduced former Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey to former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna. Pandey is also being probed in the matter.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Retail inflation eases marginally to 7.01% in June
text: The country’s retail inflation, which is measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI), eased to 7.01% in the month of June. It stood at 7.04% in May. This comes amid easing crude and edible oil prices. Further, India's factory output, measured in terms of Index of Industrial Production (IIP), witnessed a growth of 19.6% in May.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Govt forms new trade advisory body; onboards TCS CEO, KKR India chief
text: The government has constituted a new Board of Trade, an advisory body to the Commerce and Industry Ministry. The 29-member board has been constituted by merging it with the existing Council for Trade Development and Promotion (CTDP), a notification by the Directorate General of Foreign Trade announced. The body includes TCS CEO Rajesh Gopinathan and KKR India Chairman Sanjay Nayyar.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: I am naturally disappointed: Vijay Mallya on 4-month jail sentence
text: Fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya said he was "naturally disappointed" at the Supreme Court verdict sentencing him to four months in jail in a 2017 contempt of court case. Mallya was convicted of contempt in 2017 for transferring $40 million to his children in violation of court orders. The apex court also imposed a fine of ₹2,000 on him.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Twitter calls Musk's withdrawal 'invalid & wrongful', says he 'knowingly' breached deal
text: Twitter has sent a letter to Tesla CEO Elon Musk after he terminated the $44 billion acquisition deal. Terming his withdrawal as "invalid and wrongful”, Twitter said Musk "knowingly" breached the deal. "Twitter demands that Musk and...other Musk Parties comply with their obligations under the Agreement...to consummate and make effective the transactions contemplated by the Agreement," it added.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Rupee hits historic low of 79.57 against US dollar
text: The Indian rupee hit a historic low of 79.57 against the US dollar during early trade on Tuesday. On Monday, the currency had ended at another record low of 79.44 per US dollar and had witnessed an intra-day high of 79.24. Meanwhile, Sensex declined 305 points to 54,090 and Nifty slipped 108 points to 16,107 in early trade on Tuesday.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: RBI unveils new system to settle international trade payments in Indian rupee
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Monday unveiled a system for international trade settlements in the Indian rupee. The new system will be put in place to "promote the growth of global trade" and "support the increasing interest of the global trading community in INR", RBI said. The system allows for invoicing, payment and settlement of exports/imports in INR.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Euro reaches parity with US dollar for the first time in 20 years
text: The euro sank on Tuesday to reach parity with US dollar for the first time in 20 years. The currency fell to an intraday low of $1 amid concerns that an energy crisis could plunge the region's economy into recession. The concerns come after the biggest single pipeline carrying Russian natural gas to Europe was shutdown for maintenance.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Govt will bring new rules to reduce scope to violate laws : Union Minister on Uber Files
text: Speaking on The Uber Files, Union Minister Rajeev Chandrasekhar said it was "disturbing that the big tech platforms have used technology and innovations to evade scrutiny and bypass laws." He added that the government is now determined to bring in "new rules and laws that will reduce the opportunities for them to violate Indian laws or do something illegal."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Govt releases list of 4 participants of India's 1st 5G spectrum auction
text: The Centre has released a list naming Adani Data Networks, Reliance Jio, Bharti Airtel and Vodafone Idea as the participants of India’s first 5G spectrum auction which will be held on July 26. A total of 72,097.85 MHz of airwaves will be auctioned and the winner will have the right to use the spectrum for 20 years.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Uber Files whistleblower reveals himself
text: Mark MacGann, a career lobbyist who worked for Uber between 2014 and 2016, has revealed himself as the whistleblower who provided The Guardian with 1,24,000 company records that constitute The Uber Files. MacGann, a 52-year-old Irishman, served as Uber's chief lobbyist for Europe, the Middle East and Africa and oversaw government relations and public policy in more than 40 countries.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Uber was willing to break all rules, destroy taxi drivers' livelihoods: Whistleblower
text: Uber Files whistleblower Mark MacGann, who leaked 124,000 internal documents, said the company "was not legal" in most countries under his jurisdiction. "[Uber] was willing to break all the rules...use its money and its power...to destroy [taxi drivers'] livelihoods," he said. "[Drivers] needed somebody to be angry at...I became that person," MacGann said, revealing that he received death threats.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Didn't breach our obligations under merger agreement: Twitter to Musk
text: In a letter to Tesla CEO Elon Musk, Twitter said it didn't breach its obligations under the merger agreement as stated by Musk after he terminated the $44 billion deal. It added that the agreement remained in place and it would take steps to close the deal. Twitter is reportedly planning to file a lawsuit early this week in Delaware.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Picture abhi baaki hai: Unacademy CEO on firm's cost-cutting measures
text: Responding to a journalist's tweet about the recent cost-cutting measures at the firm, Unacademy's CEO Gaurav Munjal tweeted, "Picture abhi baaki hai. Abhi intermission hua hai." Munjal on Monday announced a series of cost-cutting measures to turn the firm profitable. The measures included founders and the top management taking a salary cut and free meals being prohibited in their offices.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Shaadi.com Founder offers to find Nagaland Minister a bride; he says 'Waiting for Salman'
text: After Nagaland Minister Temjen Imna Along confirmed that he's not married and shared a screenshot of Google query of people seeking to know about his wife, Shaadi.com Founder Anupam Mittal replied, "Will have to do something @ShaadiDotCom." Responding to Mittal's tweet, Temjen said, "Bhai filhal hum bindas hai (Brother, I'm fine right now). Waiting for Salman Bhai."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Gap's India-born CEO Sonia Syngal steps down after over two years
text: American clothing retail company Gap's India-born President and CEO Sonia Syngal is stepping down from her position just over two years into the role. The 52-year-old was appointed as CEO in March 2020. The company did not provide a reason for her sudden exit. Gap's Executive Chairman Bob Martin will step in as interim CEO effective immediately, the company said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: SpiceJet MD booked for allegedly cheating Gurugram man, airline responds
text: Gurugram Police has booked SpiceJet Chairman and MD Ajay Singh for allegedly defrauding a businessman. The complainant, who's a consultant in the aviation sector, has accused Singh of delivering a fake depository instruction slip of 10 lakh shares for services provided to him. SpiceJet said the complaint is "mischievous and completely bogus" and intends to hurt SpiceJet and Singh's image.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Twitter shares fall by 11.3% after Elon Musk terminates $44 billion deal
text: Twitter shares fell 11.3% to $32.65 on Monday, two days after Tesla CEO Elon Musk terminated the $44 billion acquisition deal. In comparison to Musk's $54.20 bid, this is a 40% discount and the biggest daily percentage drop in over 14 months. Meanwhile, Tesla's shares closed down almost 7%. Notably, Twitter may file a lawsuit against Musk early this week.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Chivas Regal maker Pernod Ricard puts new India investments on hold: Report
text: French spirits group Pernod Ricard, the maker of Chivas Regal, Glenlivet Scotch whisky and Absolut vodka has put its new Indian investments on hold over long-running tax disputes with authorities on valuing liquor imports, as per a report. The company had also written a letter to PM Narendra Modi in November seeking a resolution in the matter.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Twitter user asks Mahindra about Tata Motors, he says 'Privilege to have such competitors'
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra responded to a Twitter user who asked him his feelings about Tata cars. Mahindra wrote, "It's a privilege to have strong competitors like Tata Motors. They keep reinventing themselves and that inspires us to do even better...Competition spurs innovation." Commenting on his tweet, a user wrote, "There are few people who praise [their] competitors."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Lulu's biggest Indian mall opens in UP, is made with ₹2,000cr & has 11-storey parking
text: Lulu Group's biggest Indian mall made with a ₹2,000 crore investment and spread over a 22 lakh square feet area has opened in UP's Lucknow. The mall, which has 11-storey parking, was inaugurated by UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Sunday. It has a food court with a seating capacity of around 1,600 people with 15 fine dining restaurants and cafes.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Paytm records 8.5 million loans in Q1, 492% higher than last year
text: Mobile payment company Paytm said it recorded 8.5 million loans in first quarter of FY23, 492% higher than the same period last year. Paytm's disbursements crossed an Annualised Run Rate (ARR) of ₹24,000 crore on the platform. In June, the super app saw its highest monthly transacting users of 76 million, a 49% increase from year ago period.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Mahira homebuyers in Gurugram demand delivery of flats before Diwali
text: Around 100 homebuyers of Mahira Homes in Gurugram's Sector 68 held a protest on Sunday, demanding delivery of their flats before Diwali in October. The Department of Town and Country Planning cancelled the project's licence in May, alleging the developer submitted fabricated bank guarantees and forged bank officials' signatures. The licence was cancelled when 80% of construction was complete.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Coal India's capital expenditure rises 65% in June quarter
text: Coal India on Monday said its capital expenditure increased by 65% to ₹3,034 crore in the June quarter of 2022-23. In comparison, its capital expenditure was ₹1,841 crore in the April-June period of last financial year. The increase was driven by strong spending in acquiring land and strengthening transport infrastructure in the coalfields under first-mile connectivity projects, the company said.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Jubliant FoodWorks' ex-CEO Pota to lead Advent-backed Eureka Forbes
text: Pratik Pota, the former CEO of Jubilant FoodWorks Ltd (JFL), will lead Advent International's portfolio company, Eureka Forbes. Pota will take on the role of Managing Director and CEO of Eureka Forbes from August 16 and lead the management team to continue scaling the business, Advent announced. Before JFL, he held leadership roles in PepsiCo, Airtel and Hindustan Unilever.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Debt mutual funds see outflow of ₹92,248 cr in June: AMFI data
text: Mutual funds that invest in fixed-income securities, or debt funds, saw an outflow of ₹92,248 crore in June, Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI) data showed. Debt funds saw a net outflow of ₹32,722 crore in May and an inflow of ₹54,756 crore in April. Out of 16 fixed-income or debt fund categories, 14 witnessed net outflows in June.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: IOC, BPCL, HPCL may post combined ₹10,700 cr loss in Q1: Report
text: Indian Oil Corporation, Bharat Petroleum and Hindustan Petroleum may post a combined loss of ₹10,700 crore in June quarter, ICICI Securities said in a report. The three state-owned oil marketing companies are losing ₹12-14 per litre on petrol and diesel, the report said. "We estimate gross refining margins to remain fairly strong at $17-18 per barrel levels," the brokerage added.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: RBI fines three cooperative banks for non-compliance
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has fined three co-operative banks for non-compliance with certain guidelines. Nasik Merchant's Co-operative Bank was fined ₹50 lakh as it continued to accept fresh deposits in existing accounts of other non-scheduled urban co-operative banks. Maharashtra State Co-operative Bank was fined ₹37.5 lakh and The National Central Cooperative Bank in Bihar ₹2 lakh.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Bank privatisation bill could be introduced in Monsoon Session: Report
text: The government could introduce a bill for privatisation of select-public sector banks in the upcoming Monsoon Session of the Parliament, CNBC TV18 reported. The government is awaiting the views of the Law Ministry on the proposed bill, the report said. The government may lower the minimum stake in public sector banks from 51% at present to 26%, the report added.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: GSP Crop Science plans ₹500 crore IPO next year, says MD
text: Agro-chemical firm GSP Crop Science is planning to launch a ₹500 crore initial public offering (IPO) by next year, according to its Managing Director Bhavesh Shah. The Ahmedabad-based company plans to soon file a draft red herring prospectus with capital markets regulator SEBI, he said. Its revenue stood at ₹1,350 crore during the 2021-22 financial year, he added.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Vijay Mallya sentenced to 4 months in jail, fined ₹2,000 in 2017 contempt case by SC
text: The Supreme Court has sentenced fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya to four months in jail and imposed a fine of ₹2,000 on him after he was found guilty of contempt of court in 2017 for withholding information from the court. The court also reportedly ordered Mallya's family members to return $40 million transferred to them in violation of the court orders.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Return $40 mn sent to family with 8% interest in 4 weeks: SC to Mallya in 2017 case
text: The Supreme Court on Monday sentenced fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya to four months in jail for a 2017 contempt of court case. Mallya was convicted of contempt in 2017 for transferring $40 million to his children in violation of court orders. The top court has now asked Mallya to return $40 million within four weeks with 8% interest.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Rupee closes at new all-time low of 79.44 against US dollar
text: The rupee ended at a new all-time low of nearly 79.44 per US dollar on Monday. The currency on Monday opened at 79.30 against the US dollar and witnessed an intra-day high of 79.24 and a low of 79.49. Meanwhile, BSE Sensex ended 86.61 points lower at 54,395.23, while NSE Nifty declined 4.60 points on Monday.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Twitter hires US law firm that invented 'poison pill' to sue Musk for ending deal: Report
text: Twitter has reportedly hired US law firm Wachtell, Lipton, Rosen & Katz as it prepares legal action against Tesla CEO Elon Musk, who terminated the $44 billion deal. The firm served Musk as a legal adviser in his plan to take Tesla private in 2018 and its founding partner, Martin Lipton, is credited with inventing the 'poison pill' strategy.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Musk shares laughing meme as Twitter plans legal action against him for ending deal
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk shared a meme on Monday after he terminated the $44 billion Twitter deal on Friday. The meme featured Musk laughing at statements such as 'They said I couldn't buy Twitter' and 'They want to force me to buy Twitter in court'. Twitter plans to take legal action against Musk to force him to accept the deal.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: No free meals for staff, founders & top management to take salary cut: Unacademy
text: In an internal note to the staff, Unacademy's CEO Gaurav Munjal said that firm's founders and top management will take pay cuts, and the company will also shut its global test preparation business in a bid to turn profitable. He also put travel restrictions on employees, removed dedicated drivers for CXOs and stopped complimentary meals and snacks at their offices.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Have over ₹2,800 cr in our bank yet we aren’t efficient: Unacademy CEO tells staff
text: In an internal note to the employees, Unacademy CEO Gaurav Munjal announced a series of cost-cutting measures. He said, "Even though we have over ₹2,800 crore in the bank, we aren't efficient at all...There are a lot of unnecessary expenses we do...We must turn profitable asap." "These changes might seem we are in a bad state...We are not," he added.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Razorpay, Pine Labs among 1st firms to get RBI's payment aggregator, gateway licences
text: Online payment providers Razorpay and Pine Labs are among the first companies to receive in-principle approval from RBI for payment aggregator (PA) and payment gateway (PG) licences. The RBI has asked the companies to conduct an audit within the next six months for final approval. Companies like BharatPe, PhonePe and Amazon, among others, too applied for the licences.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: 'We're just f***ing illegal,' Uber executive said days after 2014 Delhi rape incident
text: Uber's former head of communications unit, Nairi Hourdajian, in an email to her colleague in 2014 said, "Remember that everything is not in your control, and that sometimes we have problems because, well, we're just f***ing illegal." The email, obtained by The Guardian, was sent six days after a 25-year-old woman passenger was raped by an Uber driver in Delhi.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Rupee hits new record low of 79.38 against US dollar
text: The Indian rupee touched an all-time low of 79.38 against the US dollar during Monday's early trade. On Friday, the Indian rupee had closed at a record low of 79.26 against the US dollar. On Monday, domestic markets opened lower with BSE Sensex declining 372.15 points to 54,109.69, and the Nifty was down nearly 0.6% at 16,126.45.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Mallya didn't show any remorse, adequate punishment must: SC in contempt case
text: The Supreme Court on Monday while sentencing fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya to four months in jail for a 2017 contempt of court case, said that the latter didn’t show any remorse and didn't appear before it during the sentencing. The court added, "Adequate punishment is a must to uphold the majesty of the law.” The court also fined him ₹2,000.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: IMF made us dance to its tune but hasn't released $6 bn loan: Pak minister
text: Pakistan's Interior Minister Rana Sanaullah said that the IMF hasn't released the tranche of the $6 billion bailout package even though it made the country "dance to its tune". Sanaullah said that the country is currently going through a difficult situation in terms of its economy and the government had accepted the IMF terms which they "weren't in favour of".
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: SpiceJet refutes reports of surprise check by DGCA & windshield crack incident
text: SpiceJet on Monday refuted reports that claimed that the windshield of one of its aircraft cracked minutes after departure from Chennai, while another flight was delayed by six hours after DGCA’s surprise inspection. On July 9, media reports emerged that a SpiceJet flight from Mumbai to Srinagar was delayed for six hours because of DGCA's surprise audit of the aircraft.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: IndiGo clarifies what is 'Cute charge' after passengers share air tickets
text: Some passengers took to Twitter and shared pictures of the price breakup of their air tickets, showing that IndiGo had levied a 'Cute charge'. Responding to one of the tweets, IndiGo said, "Please know that the CUTE charges are levied at select airports for the usage of Common User Terminal Equipment (CUTE) services...We'd love to serve you on board!"
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Won't make excuses, judge us by what we did in last 5 yrs: Uber on 'Uber files' leak
text: Responding to the 'Uber files' leak regarding its alleged malpractices, Uber admitted to its "mistakes" but said it had transformed since 2017 after current CEO Dara Khosrowshahi took over. It said, "We've not and won't make excuses for past behaviour that is clearly not in line with our present values...Judge us by what we’ve done over the last five years."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Bharti Airtel shares fall 5% as Adani Group enters 5G spectrum auction
text: Bharti Airtel shares declined nearly 5% during intraday trade on Monday. On Friday, Adani Group confirmed its participation in India's first 5G spectrum auction, which is going to be held on July 26. While Adani Group clarified that its intention is not to be in the consumer mobility space, it'll face Reliance Jio, Airtel and Vodafone Idea during the auction.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Violence guarantees success: Ex-Uber CEO in leaked emails amid driver protests
text: Leaked emails have revealed that Uber's former CEO Travis Kalanick encouraged Uber drivers to stage counter-protests amid taxi strikes and riots in Paris in 2016. Warned about its risks, Kalanick reportedly said, "I think it’s worth it...Violence guarantees success." Later, Kalanick's spokesperson said, "He never suggested Uber should take advantage of violence at the expense of driver safety."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Uber used 'kill switch' 13 times in 2014-16 in India & other nations, show leaked mails
text: The leaked emails have revealed that Uber deployed 'kill switch' 13 times between 2014-2016 in different nations globally. The 'kill switch' turned off systems in the event of serious regulatory action, like a tax raid. It was used in India, Amsterdam, and Paris, among others. In six cases it was used while raids were in progress.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Vauld's users to continue earning interest on crypto FDs: CEO
text: Crypto lending platform Vauld's users will continue to earn interest on their fixed crypto deposits, its CEO Darshan Bathija confirmed. Bathija's clarification comes after the company suspended withdrawals and deposits citing volatile conditions in the crypto market. On resuming withdrawal deposit options, he said he can't provide fixed timelines yet but is working to resume operations soon.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: SIDBI to develop online platform for startups, investors
text: The Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI) will develop an online platform to bring together startups and investors. The platform will be ready in two months, said Shruti Singh, Joint Secretary, Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT). This portal, she added, would help startups as they would not look for Alternate Investment Funds (AIFs) outside.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: German trade union calls for strike of Amazon workers on Prime Day
text: One of Germany's biggest trade unions, Verdi, has called on staff at seven Amazon warehouses across the country to go on strike during Sunday's night shift. The strike will coincide with Amazon's Prime Day sale, and has been organised as part of a longer battle regarding better pay and working conditions. Amazon doesn't expect this to impact its operations.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Trade transactions with Sri Lanka may be settled outside ACU: RBI
text: All current account transactions including trade transactions with Sri Lanka may be settled in any permitted currency outside the Asian Clearing Union (ACU) mechanism until further notice, the RBI said. The ACU facilitates payments among member countries on a multilateral basis, thereby economising on the use of foreign exchange reserves and transfer costs. Currently, it has nine members.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: India's inflation likely held steady just above 7% in June: Poll
text: India's retail inflation likely held steady just above 7% in June, a Reuters poll found. The poll of 42 economists showed inflation, as measured by the consumer price index (CPI), was steady at an annual 7.03% in June, as compared to 7.04% in May. Forecasts for the data, due on July 12, ranged from 6.45% to 7.70%.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Aurobindo Pharma to reduce raw material imports from China
text: India's second-largest pharmaceuticals firm Aurobindo Pharma is planning to significantly reduce raw material imports from China to mitigate the risk of supply chains disruptions. It currently procures around 55% of its material from China. The company is also planning to shift the manufacturing of some of its pharmaceutical formulations from India to a newly built facility in China.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Govt exempts excise duty on ATF for Indian carriers flying overseas
text: The government has exempted excise duty on Aviation Turbine Fuel (ATF) for domestic airlines flying overseas. This has brought domestic carriers at par with international airlines. However, airlines will continue to pay 11% excise duty on ATF for flying domestically. Exemption from basic and special additional excise duty would be applicable retrospectively from July 1, Finance Ministry said.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Steel price has hit bottom: Industry amid 24% drop from April peak
text: Industry experts have said the price of steel has bottomed out and there is no headroom for it to go further down. Their remarks come as the price of benchmark hot-rolled coil (HRC) dropped to ₹59,800 a tonne on July 6. This is 24% less than its April 6 peak of ₹78,000 a tonne, as per data from SteelMint.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: RBI imposes restrictions, withdrawal caps on 4 cooperative banks
text: The RBI has put withdrawal limits on four cooperative banks for six months due to their deteriorating financial positions. They also cannot grant or renew any loans, make investments or accept fresh deposits without RBI's approval. The banks include Delhi's Ramgarhia Co-operative Bank, Mumbai's Sahebrao Deshmukh Co-operative Bank and Sangli Sahakari Bank.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Musk talked about Mars, avoided discussing Twitter deal at Sun Valley: Report
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk avoided discussing the $44 billion collapsed Twitter deal at Sun Valley, as per people who attended the conference. Musk spent most of his time discussing colonising Mars and the importance of boosting the birth rate on Earth, they said. Sun Valley Conference is an annual media finance conference hosted by private investment firm Allen & Company.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Refrain from commenting about Musk's deal: Twitter to staff as it vows legal action
text: Twitter has asked its staff to not publicly comment about Elon Musk's $44 billion collapsed deal. Citing it as an ongoing legal matter, it said employees "should refrain from Tweeting, Slacking, or sharing any commentary" about the merger agreement. Meanwhile, Twitter Chairman Bret Taylor said the board will pursue legal action against Musk to enforce the merger.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Inflation may ease gradually in 2nd half of 2022-23: RBI Governor
text: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das has said that inflation may ease gradually in the second half of 2022-23. He added, "The supply outlook is appearing favourable and several high-frequency indicators point to the resilience of the recovery in the first quarter (April-June) of 2022-23...inflation may ease gradually in the second half of 2022-23, precluding...chances of a hard landing in India."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Patently untrue: Amnesty India on money laundering allegations by ED
text: Amnesty International India has tweeted that the allegations levelled by Enforcement Directorate against them for money laundering are "patently untrue". It added, "Putting a squeeze on critics through trumped-up charges...has become routine for...government." The ED fined Amnesty India and former CEO Aakar Patel over ₹61 crore citing violations of the Foreign Exchange Management Act.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: EPFO may approve new system to pay pension to over 73 lakh beneficiaries in one go
text: The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) will consider and approve a proposal for setting up a central pension disbursal system in its upcoming meeting to credit pensions to over 73 lakh beneficiaries' bank accounts in one go across India. Currently, over 138 regional offices of the EPFO disburse pensions in their region separately at different times or days.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Abe could've survived, there was a life-saving gap between two shots: Mahindra
text: Businessman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to claim that former Japan PM Shinzo Abe could have survived the assassination. "There was a potentially life-saving gap until the second shot. Shouldn't his security have jumped on Abe...and covered him," Mahindra asked. Retired IPS officer Muktesh Chander replied, "I have been in-charge of security...of 5 different PMs and ex-PMs...I definitely agree."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: IndiGo technicians go on mass leave over poor hike after mass leave by crew: Reports
text: IndiGo's aircraft maintenance technicians at major hubs like Delhi and Hyderabad took mass leave recently to protest poor increment, reports said on Sunday. This came days after the airline's flights were delayed across the country as the crew reportedly took mass sick leave to attend Air India's recruitment drive. IndiGo announced 8% hike for crew and pilots after the incident.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Paintings, sculptures worth ₹40 crore seized by CBI in DHFL bank fraud case
text: The CBI seized paintings and sculptures worth ₹40 crore during its searches at three locations in connection with India's biggest banking fraud of ₹34,615 crore by DHFL. The seized artworks reportedly include paintings by famous artists Tyeb Mehta and Manjit Bawa, worth ₹27 crore and ₹7.7 crore, respectively. Promoters allegedly bought artworks worth ₹55 crore using diverted funds, CBI said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: China fines Alibaba, Tencent for violating anti-monopoly rules
text: China imposed fines on Alibaba and Tencent along with other firms for failing to comply with anti-monopoly rules on disclosure of transactions. China's State Administration for Market Regulation released a list of 28 deals that violated the rules, out of which five involved Alibaba and 12 involved Tencent. The maximum potential fine in each case stands at $74,688, Reuters reported.
author: Bhawana Chaudhary

headlines: Mahindra may consider investing in an EV battery cell maker: CEO
text: Mahindra and Mahindra may consider investing in the EV battery-cell space if it needed to secure future supplies, CEO Anish Shah said. "Our intent is not to get into (manufacturing) batteries...There are people who do it...well," Shah stated. He added that Mahindra's deal with Volkswagen to source EV components will only meet its "short to medium term" battery needs.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Netflix's exit from Russia, inflation caused its slowdown: Co-CEO
text: Netflix Co-CEO Ted Sarandos has said there are multiple factors behind the streaming service's slowdown, including inflation's impact on household budgets, a decline in smart TV sales and its departure from Russia. "Every customer is asking the question of the value of a subscription in relation to its cost," he said. Notably, Netflix lost 2,00,000 subscribers in Q1 2022.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: RBI to release norms for digital lending this month: Report
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) will release guidelines for 'Buy Now, Pay Later' (BNPL) service and digital lending later this month, Financial Express reported. A circular could be out as early as next week, the report added. Last month, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said the regulator would introduce a framework to curb malpractices in the digital lending segment.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: India's economy needs to grow 8-10% in 25 years: Singapore minister
text: Singapore's Senior Minister and Coordinating Minister for Social Policies Tharman Shanmugaratnam said that India's economy must grow by 8-10% in the next 25 years to raise the average income of people across the country and create more jobs. Shanmugaratnam added that India needs to focus simultaneously not only on job growth but also on productivity.
author: Bhawana Chaudhary

headlines: Nearly 10.05 mn people use digital certificates for pensions: Data
text: Nearly 10.05 million people, including private citizens and ex-government employees, use digital life certificates to claim pension payments, according to official data. Out of the 10 million, 2.4 million are government pensioners, the data stated. Launched in 2014, digital certificates are verified by Unique Identification Authority of India, which sends it to bank that disburses the pensions.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Withdrawal rate falls as FPIs take out ₹4,000 crore in July so far
text: The pace of selling by foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) has declined as they withdrew over ₹4,000 crore from Indian equity markets in the first eight days of July. This comes after a net withdrawal of ₹50,203 crore in June, the highest net outflow since March 2020. Recently, the RBI announced several measures to boost foreign exchange inflows.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Would tell Adani to go into sustainable, synthetic fuels: Safran CEO
text: Safran's CEO Olivier Andries told TOI that he would tell Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani to "go into sustainable and synthetic fuels". Andries added that the French aerospace engine manufacturer has partnered with French energy major Total, which announced a strategic partnership with Adani Group. He further said they are urging Total to move up production capacity of sustainable fuel.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: India to double steel production in 8 years to 240 MT: Scindia
text: Newly-appointed Union Steel Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has said that India's steel production will double from the current 120 MT to 240 MT in the next eight years. "I will ensure that the production of steel in the country will enhance by taking medium and small industries along with the large units," he added.
author: Bhawana Chaudhary

headlines: M-cap of 8 of top 10 most valued firms jumps ₹1.81 lakh crore in past week
text: Eight of the 10 most valued domestic firms together added ₹1,81,209.89 crore in market valuation last week with Hindustan Unilever emerging as the biggest gainer. While HUL added ₹50,058.05 crore, taking its valuation to ₹5,86,422.74 crore and ICICI Bank's valuation jumped ₹35,956.8 crore to reach ₹5,25,656.96 crore. Reliance Industries and Tata Consultancy Services were among the laggards.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: CBI, I-T dept raid ex-NBCC officer Mittal's Noida house, seize ₹2 cr
text: The CBI and Income Tax Department conducted a raid at the residence of DK Mittal, a former National Buildings Construction Corporation (NBCC) officer, in Noida on Saturday. According to ANI, more than ₹2-crore cash and jewellery were recovered from his residence. The CBI has registered a disproportionate assets case against his known sources of income.
author: Bhawana Chaudhary

headlines: D-Mart owner Avenue Supermarts' profit jumps 490% to ₹680 cr in Q1
text: D-Mart owner and operator Avenue Supermarts reported a profit after tax (PAT) of almost ₹680 crore in Q1 of Financial Year 2023, after marking a jump of around 490% from ₹115.13 crore year-on-year. The Mumbai-based company also reported over 94% increase in its revenue from operations which came in at ₹9,806.89 crore.
author: Bhawana Chaudhary

headlines: SEBI may issue 'risk factor disclosures' on market trends: Report
text: The SEBI is reportedly planning to issue "risk factor disclosures" on market trends, including surges and collapses, to help investors make better decisions. Sources told PTI that the regulator has huge amounts of datasets and is in a position to analyse things that have gone good or bad for the investors. The disclosures might be made annually, half-yearly or quarterly.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: SEBI mulls bringing mutual fund units under insider trading rules
text: The SEBI has proposed to bring transactions in mutual fund units under insider trading regulations. Insiders would include those who have access to unpublished price-sensitive information and their immediate relatives. In the past, a few key personnel of a mutual fund redeemed their holdings in the schemes while in possession of "sensitive information", the SEBI noted in its discussion paper.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: AMCs added 51 lakh investor accounts in June quarter: AMFI data
text: Asset Management Companies added 51 lakh investor accounts in the June quarter, as per the data by the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI). The total tally now stands at 13.46 crore. In comparison, 93 lakh accounts were opened in the March quarter, the data further showed. Notably, the industry crossed 10 crore folios in May 2021.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: India's economic performance consistently improved in last 4 yrs: PHDCCI
text: India's economic performance consistently improved among the top 10 economies in the world over the last four years, PHD Chamber of Commerce and Industry (PHDCCI) said. It cited International Economic Resilience (IER) rankings, wherein India's position improved from 6th in 2019 to 2nd in 2022. India showed consistent improvement despite the COVID-19 crisis, PHDCCI President Pradeep Multani said.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: SpiceXpress to be hived off from SpiceJet by August 1st week: CMD
text: SpiceJet CMD Ajay Singh has said banks and shareholders have given their approval to hive off cargo and logistics company SpiceXpress from SpiceJet airline. The bifurcation will take place by the first week of August, he added. This comes after SpiceJet said in August 2021 it was transferring its logistics business on a slump sale basis to its subsidiary SpiceXpress.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Hero MotoCorp CEO Munjal steps down as CII President-Designate
text: Hero MotoCorp Chairman and CEO Pawan Munjal has stepped down as President-Designate of the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) for 2022-23. Munjal cited domestic and global business commitments as the reason behind stepping down. The CII has elected TVS Group's R Dinesh as Munjal's replacement. ITC Chairman and MD Sanjiv Puri has been elected as Vice President.
author: Bhawana Chaudhary

headlines: Elon Musk terminates $44 billion deal to buy Twitter over breach of agreement
text: The world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Friday said that he was terminating his $44 billion deal to acquire Twitter, alleging multiple breaches of the agreement. In a filing, Musk’s lawyers said Twitter had failed to respond to multiple requests for information on fake or spam accounts on the platform, which was fundamental to the company's performance.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Will pursue legal action to enforce merger: Twitter after Musk ends $44 billion deal
text: Twitter's Chairman Bret Taylor has said that the board plans to pursue legal action against Tesla CEO Elon Musk after he pulled out of the $44 billion deal. Taylor tweeted, "The Twitter Board is committed to closing the transaction on the price and terms agreed upon with Musk and plans to pursue legal action to enforce the merger agreement."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Need over ₹2,000 cr monthly, ED trying to disrupt business: Vivo on frozen accounts
text: Referring to the Enforcement Directorate freezing its bank accounts, Vivo told the Delhi High Court that it has to make monthly payments of around ₹2,826 crore towards statutory dues, salaries, rent and daily business operations. It added that ED has undertaken a "roving and fishing enquiry” against it and continues to make "various attempts to disrupt" its business.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Adani Group to participate in 5G spectrum auction; to face Jio, Airtel: Report
text: The Adani Group has reportedly applied for participating in India’s first auction of 5G airwaves starting July 26. Three telecom operators- Reliance Jio, Bharti Airtel and Vodafone Idea have submitted their applications while Adani's participation is yet to be independently confirmed. A total of 72,097.85 MHz of spectrum worth at least ₹4.3 lakh crore will be put for auction.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: What reasons did Elon Musk give for ending the $44 billion Twitter deal?
text: Apart from citing the lack of information regarding fake accounts, Tesla CEO Elon Musk's lawyers stated the insufficient data on financial condition, recent layoffs and hiring freeze by Twitter as reasons for ending the deal. The filing said Twitter fired two high-level employees and one-third of its talent acquisition team, breaching its obligation to preserve company's material components.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: End of season 1, what a cliffhanger: Twitter staff after Musk ends $44 bn deal
text: Reacting to Tesla CEO Elon Musk terminating the $44 billion Twitter deal, an employee at the social media company said, "I just don’t believe it’s actually over." Meanwhile, Amir Shevat, another Twitter employee wrote, "End of season one- what a cliffhanger." Other staff members shared memes, such as that of a rollercoaster ride and a baby screaming into a phone.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Adani Group confirms participation in India’s 1st 5G spectrum auction
text: Adani Group has confirmed that it will participate in India's first auction of 5G airwaves through the open bidding process to offer private network services. However, it said that it does not plan to enter the consumer mobility space. Other companies that have applied to acquire the telecom spectrum include Reliance Jio Infocomm, Bharti Airtel and Vodafone Idea.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Vivo India pauses all ads featuring Kohli amid money laundering probe: Report
text: Vivo India has temporarily put on hold advertisements featuring cricketer Virat Kohli amid the ED's ongoing investigation against the Chinese firm, The Economic Times reported. An executive said planned promotion activities involving Kohli were being put on hold until there's clarity on the money laundering probe. "This is also to protect Virat from criticism," another executive said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: We have 9,000 employees: Vivo tells Delhi HC after ED freezes its bank accounts
text: Vivo India on Friday approached the Delhi High Court challenging the freezing of its bank accounts by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with a money laundering case. "We have 9,000 employees. There is a liability," said advocate Siddharth Luthra. The ED seized 119 bank accounts of various entities with ₹465 crore including Vivo India's fixed deposits of around ₹66 crore.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Ola cuts jobs, delays appraisals citing business restructuring: Report
text: Ola is cutting jobs and has deferred the performance appraisal for employees for the year as it aims at "leaner and consolidated teams" to keep its "strong profitability intact", as per a report. Ola's HR reportedly told employees, "We're working on the restructuring of some of our businesses." It is reported that as many as 500 employees could be fired.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Theranos' Pak-born executive Ramesh Balwani found guilty of fraud in US
text: Ramesh 'Sunny' Balwani, the former President of Theranos and ex-boyfriend of its Founder Elizabeth Holmes, has been found guilty of fraud in US. The Pakistan-born executive was convicted on two counts of conspiracy and 10 counts of fraud. Balwani and Holmes were accused of exaggerating the abilities of Theranos' machines. The startup was valued at $9 billion before its collapse.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Who are the 5 Indian-Americans on Forbes list of richest self-made women in US?
text: Jayshree Ullal, CEO of Arista Networks, is the richest Indian-American on Forbes list of America's richest self-made women with $1.9 billion net worth. The list features Syntel Co-founder Neerja Sethi and Confluent Co-founder Neha Narkhede with $1 billion and $490 million fortune, respectively. PepsiCo's ex-CEO Indra Nooyi, who's worth $320 million, is the 4th richest Indian-American on the list.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Bullet train project chief Satish Agnihotri fired over charges of corruption
text: The Railways has terminated the services of NHSRCL MD Satish Agnihotri, who was in charge of the government's bullet train project, following a Lokpal court order directing the CBI to probe corruption allegations against him. According to officials, there were several allegations against Agnihotri, including misuse of his official position and diverting funds illegally to a private company.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Cut edible oil prices by ₹15 per litre immediately: Govt to edible oil associations
text: The government has directed leading edible oil associations to cut prices of edible oils by ₹15 per litre with immediate effect. The Centre has advised manufacturers and refiners to reduce the price of oils to distributors. "Whenever a reduction in price to distributors is made by...manufactures or refiners, the benefit should be passed on to the consumers," the government said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: I am only as old as you think I am: Mahindra after Twitter user asks his age
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Saturday responded to a Twitter user who asked him his age. Mahindra wrote, "You could've found out via Google, so I suppose this is a philosophical question. In that spirit, my answer is that 'Age (like beauty) lies in the eyes of the beholder', so I'm only as old as you think I am."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Planning to increase childcare benefits at my firms: Elon Musk
text: The world’s richest person Elon Musk on Friday said that he plans to "significantly" increase childcare benefits at his companies. Musk, who is now a father of nine children, while replying to a tweet seeking advice to those who don't have children "for cost reasons", said, "Kids are worth it...Also, Musk Foundation plans to donate directly to families."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Former PayPal executive Jasmine Lee appointed Binance.US CFO
text: Binance.US, the US partner of world's largest crypto exchange Binance, appointed ex-PayPal Holdings executive Jasmine Lee as Chief Financial Officer (CFO) on Thursday. Lee has replaced interim CFO Eric Segal, who recently left the company after holding the role since October 2021. Jasmine had previously served as CFO and Chief Operating Officer for the Consumer Product Group at PayPal.
author: Bhawana Chaudhary

headlines: Volkswagen, partners to invest $20 billion to produce EV batteries
text: German automobile manufacturer Volkswagen said the company along with its partners will invest over $20 billion to produce electric vehicle (EV) batteries. This will result in the creation of 20,000 jobs and annual sales of above $20 billion by 2030, it added. The announcement was made at the groundbreaking ceremony of the company's first battery plant in Europe.
author: Mansi Agarwal

headlines: Google proposes moving ad business to Alphabet to avoid lawsuit: Report
text: Google has offered to move its ad auctions business into a separate company under Alphabet to avoid a potential US antitrust lawsuit, reports stated. It is reportedly part of multiple concessions Google has offered the Department of Justice to avoid lawsuits alleging anti-competitive practices. The DoJ is reportedly preparing a lawsuit alleging Google's ad-tech practices are anti-competitive.
author: Bhawana Chaudhary

headlines: Decide on Vivo's request to operate bank accounts: Delhi HC to ED
text: The Delhi High Court on Friday asked the Enforcement Directorate (ED) to consider Vivo India's representation seeking permission to use its frozen bank accounts by July 13. The Chinese mobile manufacturer approached the court after ED raided 48 locations belonging to Vivo across the country.
