headlines: Rupee closes at record low against US dollar for 3rd day in a row, reaches 78.33
text: The Indian rupee slipped by 1 paisa to close provisionally at a new all-time low of 78.33 against the US dollar on Friday. The rupee initially gained during opening trade on Friday, but ended the day at a new low, marking the third consecutive day of record low closes. On Thursday, rupee settled at record low of 78.32 against dollar.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Soft drinks company Robinsons ends Wimbledon sponsorship after 86 years
text: Robinsons and Wimbledon have ended their sponsorship partnership after 86 years. One of the longest-running deals in the sport after being set up in 1935, Robinsons squash was created by Eric Smedley Hodgson, who handed out the soft drink to the players on his first visit to the tournament. The popularity of the drink moved it into commercial production.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Tesla plants in Texas & Berlin are money furnaces losing billions of dollars: Musk
text: Tesla's new factories in Texas and Berlin are "losing billions of dollars" as they struggle to increase production due to battery shortages and supply disruptions in China, said CEO Elon Musk recently. He added, "Both Berlin and Austin factories are gigantic money furnaces right now." Musk remarked, "This is...going to get fixed real fast, but requires a lot of attention."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Google allows employees in US to relocate 'without justification' after abortion ruling
text: In an email sent to its employees, Google has allowed them to relocate to another state "without justification" after US Supreme Court rolled back abortion rights. Google’s Chief People Officer Fiona Cicconi reiterated that the company’s benefits plan and health insurance in the US cover "out-of-state medical procedures that are not available where an employee lives and works."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: I've lost nearly all my wealth: Founder of crypto firm Terra whose token crashed 99%
text: Terraform Labs Founder Do Kwon told The Wall Street Journal he lost nearly all of his wealth after the cryptocurrency firm's tokens LUNA and UST collapsed. Kwon said he was probably a billionaire earlier this year when LUNA was trading near $100. In May, LUNA crashed 99% after stablecoin UST, designed to maintain its value at $1, lost its peg.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Who is Parameswaran Iyer, the retired IAS officer appointed as NITI Aayog CEO?
text: Parameswaran Iyer, who has been appointed NITI Aayog's next CEO, voluntarily retired from IAS to join the World Bank in 2009. In 2016, PM Narendra Modi chose Iyer to lead the flagship Swachh Bharat Mission. The 63-year-old resigned from his post at Department of Drinking Water and Sanitation in 2020 and returned to US to join the World Bank.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India's Russian oil imports surged over 50 times since April: Official
text: India's imports of Russian crude oil have jumped over 50 times since April and now account for 10% of all crude bought from overseas, said a government official. Prior to the Ukraine war, Russian oil made up 0.2% of all oil imported by India. The official said 40% of the Russian oil was bought by Reliance Industries and Nayara Energy.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: IKEA's newly opened store in B'luru sees 3-hr wait, long queues over the weekend
text: Long queues and a huge crowd was seen at the newly opened IKEA store in Bengaluru over the weekend. The outlet which opened in Nagasandra, saw a waiting time of around three hours for people to enter the store. Several users took to Twitter to share visuals of the overcrowded store. Reportedly, around 25,000 people visited the store on Saturday.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Russia defaults on foreign debt for 1st time since 1918 amid Western sanctions
text: Russia has defaulted on its overseas debt for the first time in more than a century. The last time Russia defaulted on its foreign debt was in 1918 during the Bolshevik Revolution. Amid the Ukraine war, while Russia said it has the money to make a $100 million payment and is willing to pay, sanctions have prevented payments to creditors.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: It puts women's lives at risk: Bill Gates on US Supreme Court's abortion ruling
text: The world’s fourth-richest man and Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates took to Twitter to react to US Supreme Court’s decision to roll back abortion rights. Gates tweeted, "This is a sad day. Reversing Roe vs Wade is an unjust and unacceptable setback...It puts women's lives at risk, especially the most disadvantaged." His ex-wife Melinda French Gates also criticised the ruling.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: This is a huge setback: Sheryl on US Supreme Court's abortion ruling
text: Outgoing Meta COO Sheryl Sandberg criticised US Supreme Court's decision to overturn a nearly 50-year-old ruling that legalised abortion. Taking to Instagram, she wrote, "The ruling jeopardizes the health and the lives of millions of girls and women...It'll make it harder for women to achieve their dreams...This is a huge setback. For ourselves, our daughters, and every generation that follows."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: 2 Dutch lawmakers propose to make work-from-home legal right in Netherlands
text: Two Dutch lawmakers are proposing legalisation to establish work-from-home as a legal right. If this is to be passed, the Netherlands would become one of the first countries to grant remote working flexibility by law. The legislation will be introduced by Steven van Weyenberg, a member of the pro-European D-66 Party, and Senna Maatoug, a lawmaker from the Green Party.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: V Krishnamurthy, hailed as the 'Father of Indian PSUs', passes away aged 97
text: Padma Vibhushan awardee Dr Venkataraman Krishnamurthy, who is hailed as the 'Father of public sector undertakings in India', has passed away at the age of 97. Krishnamurthy served as the Chairman of government-owned companies such as SAIL, GAIL (India) and BHEL between 1972 and 1990. He was also the Founding Chairman of Maruti Udyog, now known as Maruti Suzuki India.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Burj Khalifa developer Emaar's CEO detained at Delhi airport, firm responds
text: Dubai-based Emaar Properties' Group CEO Amit Jain was briefly detained on arrival at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport on Friday and handed over to police, as per reports. Responding to the reports, Emaar said, "The issue has now been resolved and we have no further comments at this time." Emaar is the developer of the world's tallest tower, Burj Khalifa.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: What are the new rules for TDS on freebies for social media influencers & others?
text: Social media influencers and doctors are among those who will have to pay 10% Tax Deducted at Source (TDS) on freebies they get for sales promotions, as per new government guidelines. The TDS, applicable from July 1 onwards, will apply to freebies retained by the persons. TDS will not apply if the benefits availed don't exceed ₹20,000 in a year.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Gautam Adani's wife Priti shares his old picture on his 60th birthday
text: On the occasion of Asia's richest person Gautam Adani's 60th birthday, his wife Priti Adani shared an old picture of him. She tweeted, "More than 36 years back, I put aside my career and began a new journey with Gautam Adani. Today, when I look back, it is only with immense respect and pride for the person he is."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Deadline for tokenisation of debit and credit cards extended to September 30
text: The RBI has extended the deadline to tokenise debit and credit cards by three months to September 30, 2022. It said that the number of transactions processed using tokens is yet to gain traction. The central bank added that an alternate system where cardholders enter the card details manually at the time of transaction hasn't been implemented by industry stakeholders.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Toblerone to no longer carry 'of Switzerland' branding as production shifts
text: Toblerone will lose the "of Switzerland" label from its front packaging after its new production site is set to open in Slovakia. The triangular chocolate bar, Toblerone, was first launched in 1908 and has been exclusively produced in Switzerland since the early 1990s. The new production line is in response to "growing demand", said Toblerone's owner Mondelez.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Wasn't sure if people would be comfortable: Sri Lankan CEO with Vitiligo on his pic
text: Sri Lankan entrepreneur Thushara Karunaratne, who is the CEO of Sui Generis and has Vitiligo, took to LinkedIn to share his picture. He wrote, "I was desperate to update my profile picture for a long time. Since I'm becoming Dichromatic due to Vitiligo...Wasn't too sure...whether my contacts would be comfortable...Just wanted to let you know...same self, lives inside."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Air India offers to re-hire pilots for 5 years after their retirement
text: Air India has offered to re-hire pilots after their retirement for a five-year period amid reports of it acquiring 300 single-aisle planes, according to internal communication. The airline is considering to re-hire them as commanders. Prior to the pandemic, Air India used to re-hire its retired pilots on contract but the practice was discontinued after late March 2020.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Fintech firms seek 6 months to comply with RBI's PPI lending directive
text: In a meeting arranged by the Digital Lenders Association of India, fintech firms have sought a six-month extension for RBI's recent mandate on PPI lending. Earlier, RBI barred non-bank wallets and pre-paid cards from offering credit lines on fintech platforms. The DLAI said it hopes to work with the RBI to safeguard the needs of all existing fintech customers.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: M-cap of 9 of top 10 most valued firms jumps ₹2.51 lakh cr in past week
text: Market capitalisation (m-cap) of nine of the top 10 most valued firms rose by ₹2.51 lakh crore in the last week, with Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) emerging as the biggest gainer. Of the top 10 firms, Reliance Industries was the sole firm whose valuation dropped. While TCS' m-cap rose by ₹74,534.87 crore, Reliance Industries' m-cap fell by ₹59,901.07 crore
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Future Enterprises defaults on ₹4.10 crore interest payment
text: Future Enterprises, a part of Future Group, on Saturday said it defaulted on an interest payment of ₹4.10 crore due on non-convertible debentures. The interest payment is due for a principal amount of ₹40 crore, Future Enterprises said in a regulatory filing. The firm had earlier defaulted on another interest payment of ₹6.07 crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Indian economy may touch $30 trillion in next 30 yrs: Piyush Goyal
text: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal on Sunday said India is one of the fastest growing economies in the world and is expected to reach $30 trillion in coming 30 years. India is currently about $3.2 trillion economy and in nine years, it'll be about $6.5 trillion, he said. We'll be about $13 trillion economy in 18 years from now, he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Wipro is much more 'growth-obsessed' than before: Rishad Premji
text: In his letter to shareholders as part of Wipro's Annual Report for FY22, Chairman Rishad Premji has said that the company has become much more "growth-obsessed" than before. With increased focus on large deals, the company has invested in hyperscaler partnerships, inorganic acquisitions, and cloud initiatives, he added. Premji also said that Wipro has transformed its structure and operating model.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: What is India's new foreign trade-related portal 'NIRYAT' launched by PM Modi?
text: PM Narendra Modi has inaugurated the new premises of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry - 'Vanijya Bhawan' in Delhi and launched a portal - NIRYAT (National Import-Export Record for Yearly Analysis of Trade). Union Minister Piyush Goyal explained, "NIRYAT is developed as a one-stop platform for stakeholders and will ensure easy access to relevant information on India's foreign trade."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Our economy has completely collapsed: Sri Lanka PM
text: Sri Lanka's Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe on Wednesday said, "The country is facing a far more serious situation beyond the mere shortages of fuel, gas, electricity and food. Our economy has completely collapsed." He added that Sri Lanka is unable to purchase imported fuel, even for cash, due to heavy debts owed by its petroleum corporation.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Harsh Goenka shares investor's response on 'falling Bitcoin price' question
text: RPG Enterprises' Chairman Harsh Goenka took to Twitter to share that he asked a Bitcoin investor if he was worried about the falling Bitcoin price. The investor replied that "he's worried but he sleeps like a baby". However, the investor later clarified, "Like a baby...I sleep for a couple of hours, then wake up, cry...and then go back to sleep."
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Netflix fires 300 employees citing slower revenue growth
text: Netflix has fired about 300 employees or 4% of its workforce, mostly based in the US, in the second round of job cuts after losing subscribers for the first time in over a decade. "We made these adjustments so that our costs are growing in line with our slower revenue growth," said Netflix. It had cut 150 jobs last month.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Harsh Goenka calls rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde his lookalike, shares pic
text: Amid political crisis in Maharashtra after Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde moved to a Guwahati hotel with over 40 rebel MLAs, RPG Enterprises' Chairman Harsh Goenka has called Shinde his lookalike. Sharing a collage of their pictures, Goenka tweeted, "In Guwahati, if anyone wants to reach me." "Never knew you were the doppelgänger of Shinde saab," a Twitter user reacted.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Video of Tata Nexon EV catching fire in Mumbai goes viral; car maker responds
text: A video showing Tata Nexon EV on fire in Mumbai has gone viral on social media. The cause of the incident is unknown yet. "A detailed investigation is currently being conducted to ascertain the facts of this isolated incident...This is the first such incidence after more than 30,000 EVs have cumulatively covered over 100 million km," Tata Motors responded.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Talks are underway regarding launch of Indian retail store chains in Russia: Putin
text: During the BRICS Business Forum, Russian President Vladimir Putin said, "Negotiations are underway to open Indian chain stores in Russia." He further said that there has been a noticeable increase in the exports of Russian oil to India. Putin also said that Russian IT companies are expanding their activities in India.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Axis MF ex-fund manager Viresh Joshi sues firm over wrongful termination
text: Viresh Joshi, a former fund manager at Axis Mutual Fund, has filed a lawsuit alleging wrongful termination in connection with a suspected front-running case and demanded ₹54 crore in damages from the firm. Assistant fund manager Deepak Agarwal is also being probed in the same case. Joshi had also sent a legal notice to Axis MF on May 20.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: CBI books former DHFL officials in India's biggest banking fraud worth ₹34,615 crore
text: CBI has registered a fresh case against DHFL's Kapil Wadhawan and Dheeraj Wadhawan for allegedly cheating a 17-bank consortium led by Union Bank of India of ₹34,615 crore, making it the biggest banking fraud probed by the agency. CBI is carrying out searches at 12 locations in Mumbai. The agency acted on a complaint from the bank on February 11.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Asia's richest man Gautam Adani pledges ₹60,000 crore to charity to mark his 60th b'day
text: Gautam Adani, Asia's richest person, has pledged to donate ₹60,000 crore to social causes to mark his 60th birthday, which falls on June 24, as well as his father's 100th birth anniversary. "Adani Family is gratified to commit ₹60,000 crore...towards healthcare, education and skill-development across India," he tweeted. "Contribution to help build an equitable, future-ready India," Adani added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Sensex rises 443 points to close at 52,265, Nifty crosses 15,500 mark
text: Sensex rose 443.19 points on Thursday to close at 52,265.72 points while Nifty rose 143.35 points to close at 15,556. Both indices had declined on Wednesday, two days after ending their six-day losing streak. Reliance Industries, Coal India and NTPC were among the top Nifty losers while Maruti Suzuki, Hero MotoCorp and Eicher Motors were among the top gainers.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Amul head hospitalised after his car hits divider and overturns in Gujarat
text: RS Sodhi, Managing Director of India's leading dairy cooperative GCMMF, which markets products under Amul brand, was hospitalised after a road accident near Anand town in Gujarat on Wednesday night. The car in which he was travelling overturned after hitting a divider, said Deputy Superintendent of Police BD Jadeja. Both Sodhi and the driver are out of danger, added Jadeja.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: We have never explored exiting India, not even for a minute: Uber on exit report
text: After a report said that Uber explored selling the India business, the company said, "We've never explored exiting India—not even for a minute. India is as important to Uber today as it was when we launched nine years ago." Calling the report "false", the firm said, "We're serving riders...across more than 100 cities...and planning for the next decade and beyond."
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: 91-yr-old billionaire Rupert Murdoch, model Jerry Hall to divorce after 6 yrs: Reports
text: Billionaire media tycoon Rupert Murdoch and model Jerry Hall are getting a divorce, reports said. Murdoch and Hall married at a mansion in London in 2016. The divorce would be a fourth for 91-year-old Murdoch, whose News Corporation empire controls major outlets including Fox News and The Wall Street Journal in US, and The Sun and The Times in UK.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: UK inflation rate hits new 40-year high of 9.1%
text: The UK inflation rate has increased to 9.1%, the highest rate in 40 years, the UK government said. On a monthly basis, the Consumer Prices Index (CPI) rose by 0.7% in May 2022 as compared to 0.6% rise in May 2021. The CPI including owner occupiers' housing costs came in at 7.9% in the 12 months to May 2022.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: UK introduces new tranche of trade sanctions against Russia
text: The United Kingdom introduced a new tranche of trade sanctions against Russia for the latter's invasion of Ukraine, a government notice said on Thursday. The tranche includes sanctions on export of jet fuel and sterling or European Union-denominated banknotes. Sanctions have also been placed on export of goods and technology related to chemical and biological weapons and additional oil refining.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Russian shipping firm's oil tankers get India's safety certification
text: Indian Register of Shipping (IRClass) is providing safety certification for over 80 ships managed by a Dubai subsidiary of top Russian shipping group Sovcomflot, official data showed. This is being done to enable oil exports to India and elsewhere after certifiers withdrew their service due to sanctions imposed on Russia. IRClass is certifying the ships' safety and seaworthiness.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Nike to fully exit Russia, will scale down operations in coming months
text: Sportswear brand Nike is making a full exit from Russia, the company said in a statement on Thursday. Nike had said on March 3 that it would temporarily suspend operations at all its Nike-owned and operated stores in Russia in response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Nike said it will be scaling down operations over the coming months.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Tether to launch stablecoin pegged to the British Pound in July
text: Crypto firm Tether on Wednesday said it'll launch GBP₮, a stablecoin pegged to the British Pound Sterling, in early July. Tether operates a dollar-pegged stablecoin, the largest stablecoin by market cap, apart from stablecoins pegged to the Euro, the Chinese Yuan and the Mexican Peso. "The creation of GBP₮ will...provide a faster, less costly option for asset transfers," Tether said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Accel rolls out $4 billion late-stage fund
text: In a blogpost, venture capital firm Accel has announced the close of a $4 billion global late-stage fund. Describing the fund as 'a critical element in global strategy', the company said it plans to use the fund to provide expansion capital to firms in its portfolio. Accel has been an early investor in companies such as Swiggy, Freshworks and Flipkart.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Tesla-rival Nikola's founder faces new charge over ranch purchase
text: Tesla-rival Nikola's billionaire Founder Trevor Milton, who is already facing fraud charges, is facing a new charge related to buying a Utah ranch, a purchase he paid for in part with an option to buy Nikola stock. As per the complaint, Milton misrepresented the state of Nikola's business to convince the seller to accept an option to buy Nikola stock.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: India's current account deficit declines to $13.4 bn in Q4 FY22
text: India's current account deficit declined from $22.2 billion, or 2.6% of GDP, in October-December 2021 to $13.4 billion, or 1.5% of GDP, in January-March 2022, according to data released by the RBI. Additionally, the current account deficit in FY22 was 1.2% against a surplus of 0.9% in FY21. Imports rose from $398.5 billion in FY21 to $618.6 billion in FY22.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Mumbai accounts for 20% of India's stalled realty projects: CREDAI-MCHI
text: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region accounts for over 20% of stalled realty projects in India, said CREDAI-Maharashtra Chamber of Housing Industry (MCHI) President Boman Irani. As of June 1, out of 35,488 projects in India, 9,304 were completed and over 26,000 remained pending, including regular and stalled projects. "It's important to complete [projects] to maintain a steady cash inflow," Irani said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Softbank Group Intl CEO quits after 5 months to pursue new opportunities
text: French businessman Michel Combes, who joined as SoftBank Group International CEO in January, has resigned, the company announced on Wednesday. Alex Clavel, the company's Managing Partner, will replace Combes from June 30. According to SoftBank, Combes has decided to leave the company to pursue new opportunities. "I'm confident that Clavel's experience...will serve us well," said CMD Masayoshi Son.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: CBI arrests OPG Securities MD Sanjay Gupta in NSE co-location scam case
text: CBI has arrested Delhi-based broker and OPG Securities Managing Director Sanjay Gupta in the National Stock Exchange (NSE) co-location scam case. CBI carried out searches and arrested Gupta from his office in Mumbai on Tuesday evening. According to officials, Gupta had allegedly managed to get access to a Mumbai-based syndicate to influence SEBI officials probing the co-location scam case.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Sensex falls 1.35% two days after ending 6-day losing streak, Nifty at 15,400
text: Sensex dropped 709.54 points, or 1.35%, on Wednesday to close at 51,822.53 while Nifty fell 225.50 points, or 1.44%, to close at 15,413.30. This comes two days after both market indices ended their six-day losing streak. Tata Steel, Reliance Industries, Wipro and IndusInd Bank were among the top Sensex losers while Tata Consultancy Services and PowerGrid closed in the green.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: GoM proposes removing GST exemptions on financial services, e-waste
text: The Group of Ministers (GoM) has proposed removal of exemptions on multiple services, including services provided by financial sector and for hospital rooms above a tariff threshold. The GoM further proposed raising GST rate on electronics waste from 5% to 18%. They also proposed a rate hike for goods and services related to petroleum and coal-bed methane exploration.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Musk's $44 bn deal in 'best interests' of Twitter & its shareholders, says its board
text: Twitter's board has recommended that shareholders vote in favour of the proposed $44 billion sale of the company to billionaire Elon Musk, a regulatory filing showed on Tuesday. The social media giant's board of directors has unanimously determined that the merger agreement is "advisable and in the best interests of Twitter and its stockholders", the filing showed.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: What is debit and credit cards tokenisation rule to be implemented from July 1?
text: The card tokenisation rule, which was issued by the RBI last year and is slated to be implemented from July 1, bars merchants from storing customer card data like card number and CVV in their servers. Tokenisation of a card means replacement of actual card details with a unique alternate code called the 'token' at online platforms.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: People who aren't wealthy encouraged me to buy, support Dogecoin: Musk
text: World's richest man Elon Musk during the Qatar Economic Forum said he intends to personally keep supporting Dogecoin. "A lot of people who are not that wealthy...have encouraged me to buy and support Dogecoin...I'm responding to those people," Musk said. The 50-year-old Tesla CEO was recently sued by a Dogecoin investor for $258 billion for allegedly running a pyramid scheme.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air's first aircraft lands in Delhi, pic released
text: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed airline Akasa Air on Tuesday received the first of its 72 Boeing 737 MAX aircraft at the Indira Gandhi International Airport in New Delhi. "Touchdown! #QPComesHome," the airline tweeted, along with a picture of the Boeing aircraft. "The delivery of...first aircraft brings the airline closer to obtaining its Air Operator's Permit," Akasa Air said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Zerodha, Upstox restore services after major websites suffer brief outage
text: Online brokerage firms Zerodha and Upstox said their services had been restored after they experienced a brief outage on Tuesday.  The outage, which affected major websites across the globe, was caused due to a technical glitch at Cloudflare, an internet infrastructure provider. Zerodha said all its sites were functional again, whereas Upstox said the issue has been resolved.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Non-banks cannot load credit lines into prepaid payment instruments: RBI
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has issued a clarification saying that non-bank prepaid payment instruments (PPIs) such as wallets and prepaid cards, cannot load credit lines into these instruments. "Such practice, if followed, should be stopped immediately," the RBI said in a notification. According to reports, the RBI has sent the notification to non-bank PPI issuers, including fintech startups.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Biocon subsidiary executive booked for bribing to waive off trial of insulin drug
text: The CBI has detained a Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation official for allegedly receiving ₹4 lakh bribe to waive off phase 3 clinical trial of the Insulin Aspart injection, an underdevelopment product of Biocon Biologics. An executive of Biocon Biologics, a company founded by Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw, was also booked. Shaw and Biocon Biologics have denied the bribery charges.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Agnipath will make disciplined, trained youth available for industry: Tata Sons
text: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran has said, "Agnipath is not just a great opportunity for the youth to serve the nation's defence forces but it will also make available a very disciplined and trained youth for the industry, including the Tata Group." "We at Tata Group recognise the potential of the Agniveers and welcome the opportunity this represents," he added.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: If Tatas can't make Air India work, no one else in India can: Emirates President
text: Emirates President Tim Clark said Tata Group taking over Air India is the best thing that could have happened to the airline. "It's not easy to operate in the Indian market...If Tatas can't make it work, nobody...will be able to make it work," he added. When asked about how Air India's rise will affect Emirates, Clark said, "Bring it on."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: 116-year-old Kellogg Co to split into 3 separate companies
text: American multinational food manufacturing giant Kellogg Company said it will split into three separate firms, focused on cereals, snacks and plant-based foods. The spinoff of the yet-to-be-named cereal and plant-based foods companies will likely be completed by end of 2023. The 116-year-old firm's snacks division earned $11.4 billion in 2021, while cereal accounted for $2.4 billion in sales.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Sensex jumps over 900 points to end at 52,532, Nifty reclaims 15,600
text: The Sensex on Tuesday jumped 934 points to close at 52,532, whereas the Nifty reclaimed its 15,600 level, settling 288 points higher at 15,638. All the sectoral indices ended in the green with IT, metal, oil and gas, power, realty and PSU bank surging 3-6%. Titan, Hindalco Industries, JSW Steel, Coal India, and Adani Ports were among top Nifty gainers.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: RIL, its 2 officers fined ₹30 lakh for late disclosure of Jio-Facebook deal in 2020
text: Reliance Industries (RIL) and two of its compliance officers have been fined ₹30 lakh by the SEBI for violating fair disclosure norms during Facebook's ₹43,574 crore investment in Jio Platforms in 2020. RIL didn't disclose the deal even after newspaper reports in March 2020 published price-sensitive details about the investment, leading to a rise in its share price, SEBI said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Deadline to implement certain norms related to credit cards extended to Oct 1
text: The RBI has extended the deadline to implement certain norms related to credit cards by three months to October 1. The norms state that card-issuers must seek OTP-based consent before activating a credit card, if not activated by the customer themselves for over 30 days. Further, they must ensure the credit limit isn't breached without seeking explicit consent from cardholder.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: There are still a few unresolved matters with $44-bn Twitter deal: Musk
text: World's richest person Elon Musk on Tuesday said there are still a few unresolved matters with his $44-billion Twitter deal, including the number of spam users. "We're still awaiting resolution on that matter, and that is a very significant matter," Musk said. "And then of course, there's the question of will the debt portion...come together?" he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Tesla fires both its LGBTQ+ head & diversity lead in US: Report
text: Electric carmaker Tesla has laid off its LGBTQ+ President Bobby Berretta-Paris and a software engineer involved in the diversity and inclusion program, Electrek reported. This comes after Tesla CEO Elon Musk last month said, "The woke mind virus will destroy civilisation." Berretta-Paris was hired as a recruiter and was promoted thrice during his five-year tenure.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: TerraUSD issuer's staff put on no-fly list in S Korea after token's collapse
text: Multiple staff of Terraform Labs, the firm behind the stablecoin TerraUSD, have been put on a no-fly list, an official at South Korea's Supreme Prosecutors' Office said. This comes after TerraUSD lost roughly $17.5 billion in value last month while dragging its sister coin Luna with it. TerraUSD has fallen from its high of $1.0098 in November 2021 to $0.0085.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: About 1,100 workers resume work at Ford India's TN plant: Report
text: About 1,100 workers have resumed work at Ford India's Maraimalai Nagar plant in Tamil Nadu even though an agreement on workers' severance packages has not been reached, according to reports. A workers' union official said there has been no progress in talks with the management. We're willing to talk after workers resume duty, Ford India's management has reportedly said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Tesla fired over 500 US plant workers without prior notice: Lawsuit
text: Elon Musk-owned Tesla has been sued by two former workers who allege it fired over 500 employees without giving advance notice. The two workers said they were terminated from Tesla's Gigafactory plant in Nevada in June. They allege Tesla violated federal laws on mass layoffs that require companies to provide a 60-day notice.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: SoftBank overseas business chief quits after 6 months in the role
text: SoftBank has appointed Alex Clavel as chief executive of SoftBank Group International unit, replacing Michel Combes who quit after just six months in the role. Clavel earlier spent 19 years at Morgan Stanley before joining SoftBank in 2015. He had participated in the restructuring of office space-sharing firm WeWork and the integration of Latin American funds into the Vision Fund.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: 3,000 Amrapali homebuyers not to be allotted flats due to payment dues
text: Around 3,000 homebuyers of Amrapali housing projects in Noida and Greater Noida will not be allotted flats for failing to clear payment dues and for not updating their details on portal. Buyers who have updated their details on time are required to pay the dues within July 7, failing which they will also lose flat, SC receiver R Venkataramani said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Oil rises $2 to cross $116 mark on rising demand, tight supply
text: Oil price on Tuesday crossed the $116 mark on high fuel demand as supplies remained tight because of sanctions imposed on Russian oil. While Brent crude rose $2.06 to $116.08/barrel, US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) rose $1.72 to $111.28/barrel. European Union leaders had agreed on May 30 to partially ban the import of Russian oil to EU nations.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Economy faces low stagflation risk due to prudent policy support: Govt
text: Indian economy faces low risk of stagflation, thanks to prudent stabilisation policies, the Finance Ministry said in its monthly economic report. RBI's monetary policy is now fully dedicated to reining in inflationary pressures, the Ministry further said. Economic activities' momentum in April and May 2022 augurs well for India continuing to be quickest growing economy in FY23, it added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: IDBI Bank to sell Great Indian Tamasha Company's assets to recover dues
text: IDBI Bank has put properties of the Great Indian Tamasha Company (GITC) on sale for non-payment of dues on loans it took from three banks. The immovable properties, which will be sold through e-auction next month, are located in Karnataka's Kodagu. GITC owes ₹86.48 crore to IDBI Bank, ₹6.26 crore to HDFC Bank and ₹49.23 crore to Bank of Baroda.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Deal was signed before we cut ties: Tata Steel on buying coal from Russia
text: Tata Steel imported about 75,000 tonnes of coal from Russia in the second half of May, Reuters reported. Tata Steel had said in April that it was taking "a conscious decision to stop doing business with Russia". A Tata Steel spokesperson said the deal to import coal was made before the company's announcement to cut ties with Russia.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Mutual funds can resume investing in international stocks: SEBI
text: Market regulator SEBI has permitted mutual funds to again invest in foreign stocks within the aggregate mandated limit of $7 billion. SEBI has also set a separate limit of $1 billion for investment in overseas exchange-traded funds. SEBI had asked mutual funds to stop investing in foreign stocks to avoid breach of the industry-wide overseas limit it had set.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: UK PM hails India-UK FTA as 'biggest of them all' post-Brexit
text: United Kingdom's Prime Minister Boris Johnson on Monday hailed the India-UK Free Trade Agreement (FTA) as the biggest FTA yet in post-Brexit context. He added that a draft of the FTA is likely to be completed by Diwali this year. "Things are going so well, we are completing chapters so rapidly," Indian High Commissioner to UK had said on Friday.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Bitcoin declines for record 12th consecutive day, falls as low as $17,600
text: Bitcoin, the world's largest cryptocurrency by market value, declined for a record-breaking 12th consecutive day late Saturday. Bitcoin fell as much as 15% to $17,599, before recovering some of its losses and trading at $19,075 on Sunday. The total market value of cryptocurrencies was around $881 billion on Sunday, down from a peak of $3 trillion in November 2021.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Serious problem: Goenka on pic of man's resignation letter saying 'not having fun'
text: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka shared a picture of a man's resignation letter saying, "Dear Harsh, I resign. Mazaa nahin aa raha (I'm not having fun)." Sharing the letter on LinkedIn, Goenka wrote, "This letter is short but very deep. A serious problem...we all need to solve." Several users reacted to the post, agreeing that it is a serious problem.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: I'll keep supporting Dogecoin: Musk after being sued for $258 bn for promoting it
text: World's richest person Elon Musk tweeted, "I will keep supporting Dogecoin," days after he was sued for $258 billion for allegedly running a pyramid scheme to support the cryptocurrency. Dogecoin investor Keith Johnson accused Musk, Tesla and SpaceX of promoting Dogecoin to profit from its trading. He's seeking three times the decline in Dogecoin's value since May 2021 in damages.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Musk says Starlink's default Wi-Fi will be named 'Stinky', Twitter users react
text: The world's richest person and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk on Saturday tweeted, "We're changing Starlink's default Wi-Fi name to Stinky." Calling it "unique", he said it will "encourage people to change it". Reacting to his post, Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao wrote, "Unforgettable. What is the default password then? Tofu?" Another user also wrote, "I'd be...funnier for a billion dollars."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Encourage team to express contrary views: Namita on traits of a leader
text: Emcure Pharmaceuticals Executive Director and Shark Tank India judge Namita Thapar took to Twitter to share traits of being a leader. She wrote, "Culture of dissent unleashes creativity and innovation...I've seen good leaders who get told...that they're wrong...they think, accept and adapt. One of the most important traits of a leader- encourage the team to express contrary views!"
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: 'Agniveers' will be able to adjust into several careers: Naukri.com Founder
text: Naukri.com Founder Sanjeev Bikhchandani took to Twitter amid protests over the government's 'Agnipath' recruitment scheme. In a long Twitter thread, he wrote that 'Agniveers' will be "able to adjust into any one of several careers" and that he can bet "many of the 75% who don't stay in the armed forces long term will be...good talent for the private sector".
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: 'Women pregnant over 3 months temporarily unfit,' says Indian Bank; DCW sends notice
text: Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) has issued a notice to Indian Bank to withdraw its new recruitment rule that declared women with over three months of pregnancy "temporarily unfit" to join the bank. The bank added that candidates would be re-examined six weeks after their delivery for appointment in the bank. DCW called the bank's action "discriminatory and illegal".
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Finance Minister shares 4 industry leaders' views on 'Agnipath'
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman shared views of industry leaders, praising the Agnipath scheme. "Agnipath scheme will create a disciplined talent pool," JSW Steel's Sajjan Jindal said. "Mahindra Group welcomes the opportunity to recruit such trained young people," Anand Mahindra said. "The highly disciplined youth will become a talent pool for the industry," FICCI President Sanjiv Mehta said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Govt asks staff to opt for cheapest fares, book tickets 21 days prior to cut costs
text: The Finance Ministry has asked government employees to opt for tickets with the "cheapest fare available" for entitled travel class and book air tickets at least 21 days prior in a bid to cut expenses. The Ministry further asked employees to avoid "unnecessary cancellations" and that they should book only one ticket for each leg of the journey.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Mahindra Group welcomes opportunity to recruit 'Agniveers': Anand Mahindra
text: Businessman Anand Mahindra on Monday assured employment to 'Agniveers' in his company. He tweeted, "Saddened by the violence around the 'Agnipath' program. When the scheme was mooted last year, I stated- and I repeat, that the discipline and skills 'Agniveers' gain will make them eminently employable. The Mahindra Group welcomes the opportunity to recruit such trained, capable young people."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: SpiceJet plane didn't catch fire, its engine expelled flames: Jet Airways CEO
text: Jet Airways CEO Sanjiv Kapoor said that the SpiceJet flight which made an emergency landing in Patna after a fire incident did not catch fire. "The engine exhausted or expelled flames after what appears to be some FOD (foreign object damage) ingestion or perhaps a bird strike," Kapoor tweeted. He added, "Incidentally engines are always on fire...it is called combustion."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: RPG group to employ Agniveers, hope other corporates also join us: Goenka
text: RPG Enterprises' Chairman Harsh Goenka said the company welcomes the opportunity to employ Agniveers. "I do hope other corporates will also join us to take this pledge and assure our youths of a future," Goenka tweeted. Earlier, Anand Mahindra said Mahindra Group would welcome opportunity to recruit "trained, capable" Agniveers amid protests against the Centre's 'Agnipath' recruitment scheme.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: China's oil imports from Russia jump by 55% in May amid sanctions
text: China's imports of discounted Russian crude oil have surged 55% from a year earlier to a record level in May, replacing Saudi Arabia as its top supplier. China, which is the world's biggest crude oil importer, received roughly 1.98 million barrels per day (bpd) from Russia amid sanctions. Notably, Russia also became India's second-biggest supplier of oil in May.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Air India planning to buy over 200 new planes; 70% to be narrow-bodied jets
text: Tata Group-owned Air India is considering purchasing more than 200 new planes with 70% of them being narrow-bodied aircraft, as per sources in the aviation industry. Air India has not bought a single aircraft since 2006 when it bought 111 aircraft, 68 from Boeing and 43 from Airbus. Currently, it has 79 narrow-bodied planes in its fleet.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Vedanta shares fall 7% after company puts Tuticorin copper plant for sale
text: Vedanta shares fell by 7% in early trade on Monday after the company put its copper plant in Tamil Nadu up for sale. Vedanta has invited Expression of Interest (EoI) from potential buyers for its Tuticorin-based smelter, which has been shut since mid-2018, following a state government order. The plant was shut down over an alleged violation of environmental norms.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Top 10 most valued firms lose ₹3.91 lakh crore in m-cap in past week
text: The market valuation of the top-10 most valued firms declined by ₹3.91 lakh crore past week, with TCS and Reliance Industries taking the biggest hit. While market valuation of TCS dropped by ₹1,01,026.4 crore to ₹11,30,372.45 crore, RIL's market valuation tanked ₹84,352.76 crore to reach ₹17,51,686.52 crore. Last week, the BSE Sensex dipped 5.42%, while NSE Nifty declined 5.61%.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Govt to convert debt in Vodafone Idea to equity before 5G auction: Report
text: The government will convert its ₹16,133 crore debt interest in Vodafone Idea (Vi) into equity ahead of the 5G spectrum auction, Financial Express reported. After the equity conversion, the government will hold a 32% stake in Vi, while the promoters' stake will be diluted from 75% to 50%. Vi's board will reportedly accomplish the conversion in 2-3 weeks' time.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: FPIs withdraw net ₹31,430 crore in 13 trading sessions in June
text: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) have continued their eight-month selling streak and have withdrawn net ₹31,430 crore from the Indian stock market till June 17. With this, the total net outflow by FPIs so far in 2022 has reached ₹1.98 lakh crore, data with depositories showed. FPIs have also withdrawn net ₹2,503 crore from the debt market so far in June.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Will be happy if upper, lower caps on airfares are raised: Vistara CEO
text: Vistara will be happy if lower and upper limits on airfares are increased, CEO Vinod Kannan said on rising jet fuel prices. The best solution would be for airlines to have absolute freedom on airfares, he added. Sharp increase in fuel prices have left domestic airlines with no choice but to raise airfares immediately, SpiceJet CMD Ajay Singh had said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Multiple preliminary bids received for Ferro Scrap Nigam buyout: Govt
text: The government on Monday said it has received multiple preliminary bids for disinvestment of Ferro Scrap Nigam Limited (FSNL). "Multiple Expressions of Interest received for strategic disinvestment of FSNL," Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) Secretary TK Pandey tweeted. DIPAM would invite financial bids from potential buyers of FSNL after completion of due diligence.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Selling petrol, diesel at ₹14-25 loss unsustainable: Pvt retailers
text: Federation of Indian Petroleum Industry (FIPI) has told the Petroleum and Natural Gas Ministry that selling diesel at ₹20-25/litre below cost and petrol at ₹14-18/litre below cost is unsustainable. FIPI, which has members like Indian Oil and Nayara Energy, said losses on fuel sales will limit further investments in retailing business. This comes as state-owned retailers have frozen fuel prices.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Govt to extend ESI scheme across country by end of 2022
text: The Union Labour Ministry said on Sunday that the Employees' State Insurance (ESI) scheme will be extended to all 744 districts of the country by the end of 2022. During the 188th meeting of the ESI Corporation, it was also decided that ESIC will set up 23 new 100-bed hospitals and multiple dispensaries across India.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Sequoia asks court to dismiss defamation case filed by Algo Legal: Report
text: Sequoia Capital India has asked a local court to dismiss a defamation case filed by its ex-general counsel Sandeep Kapoor's firm Algo Legal, Reuters reported. Sequoia said Kapoor's lawsuit is an attempt to curb its free speech rights. Algo Legal alleged that Sequoia, in an email to its portfolio firms, made baseless references to "concerning details" about the law firm.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India facing challenges of reining in inflation, sustaining growth: Govt
text: Finance Ministry on Monday said India faces multiple near-term challenges like reining in inflation, sustaining economic growth and managing fiscal deficit while maintaining a fair value of the Rupee. Many countries, especially developed countries, face similar challenges, the Ministry said. "India is better placed to weather these challenges because of its financial sector stability," it added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India fully protected farmers, MSMEs' interests at WTO meet: Goyal
text: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal on Sunday said India "fully protected the interests of farmers, MSMEs and fishermen" at WTO's 12th ministerial conference. "Our fishermen will have full freedom in our Exclusive Economic Zones...we've ensured the minimum support price stays (for farmers)," he added. India had opposed WTO's global deal to eliminate fisheries subsidies.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Sensex ends 6-day losing streak, closes 237 points higher at 51,597
text: Sensex on Monday rose 237.42 points to end its six-day losing streak and close at 51,597.84 while Nifty rose 56.65 points to close at 15,350. Hindustan Unilever, HDFC and Wipro were among the top gainers on Sensex while Tata Steel, Reliance Industries and SBI were among the top losers. Sensex has dropped 2.25% in the last five trading sessions.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Interesting: Musk on 'leaked' internal chats of Twitter staff on his meeting
text: Billionaire Elon Musk reacted to purported leaked chats of Twitter staff after he called an 'all hands meeting' on Thursday. "Interesting," said Musk, while reacting to a video compilation of the staff's reaction to his meeting. An engineer criticised the Twitter board saying they sold the company "to someone who cannot get through a single coherent sentence about this platform".
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Govt declares ICICI, HDFC, NPCI's computer resources to be 'protected systems'
text: The government has declared computer resources of ICICI Bank, HDFC Bank and UPI managing entity NPCI to be 'protected systems' under the IT Act, 2000. This implies that any harm to these resources can have an impact on national security, economy, public health or safety. Further, any unauthorised person accessing these resources may be jailed for up to 10 years.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Investors poorer by ₹18.17 lakh crore as markets decline for 6th straight session
text: Investors' wealth eroded by ₹18.17 lakh crore in six trading sessions as markets continue to decline amid extremely bearish sentiments. Benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty logged their worst weekly losses since May 2020, with Sensex hitting one-year-low of 50,921 on Friday. The decline comes amid rate hikes by global central banks, unrelenting foreign fund outflows and rising crude oil prices.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Sensex, Nifty log worst week in over 2 years dragged by IT, metal stocks
text: Benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty extended their fall for the sixth straight session on Friday, marking their worst week in over two years since the week ended May 8, 2020. Sensex ended 135 points lower at 51,360, whereas Nifty dipped 67 points to 15,293. All sectoral indices logged losses, with metal and IT indices declining the most in the week.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Bitcoin falls below $20,000 for the 1st time since December 2020
text: Bitcoin on Saturday fell below $20,000 for the first time since December 2020. The largest token by market value is currently trading at $19,155. Ether breached the $1,000 mark briefly and dropped to $999.86, the lowest since January 2021, before paring losses. Bitcoin has plunged nearly 70% since its peak in November 2021.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: I don't really care what the title is: Musk on whether he plans to be Twitter's CEO
text: World's richest person Elon Musk addressed a question during a meeting with Twitter employees asking if he plans to take over as CEO after closing the $44-billion deal. "I don't really care what the title is, but obviously, people do need to listen to me," Musk said. He added that he wants to "drive the product in a particular direction".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: SpaceX fired at least 5 employees for writing letter criticising CEO Musk: Report
text: SpaceX has fired at least five employees for their involvement in the letter that criticised CEO Elon Musk's behaviour, as per a report. In the letter, the employees stated that Musk's behaviour was a "distraction and embarrassment" for them. SpaceX President Gwynne Shotwell said that the employees "pressured other staff to sign onto something that did not reflect their views".
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: TCS must reinstate techie fired in 2015, pay 7 years' salary, orders Chennai court
text: A Chennai court has ordered Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) to reinstate a techie fired during mass layoffs in 2015 and pay him seven years' salary and benefits in full. TCS said it fired Thirumalai Selvan over his performance and that he was a manager, not a workman. The principal nature of Selvan's work is only skilled technical work, court ruled.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tesla cut job postings by 14%, has fired 20 employees since Musk's email
text: Tesla has cut job postings by 14% ever since CEO Elon Musk's email warned of 10% job cuts at the company as he had a "super bad feeling about the economy". Additionally, about 20 Tesla employees have been fired in the past week. Tesla also cancelled three online recruitment events for China that were scheduled for this month.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: SpaceX fires employees who wrote 'Musk's behaviour is a distraction' letter: Report
text: SpaceX has reportedly fired employees who helped write an open letter criticising CEO Elon Musk's behaviour. As per a report, SpaceX President Gwynne Shotwell sent an email saying the company had investigated and "terminated a number of employees involved" with the letter. The employees had stated that Musk's behaviour was a "distraction and embarrassment" for them.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Musk's behaviour is a source of distraction & embarrassment: SpaceX employees
text: In an internal letter to executives, a group of SpaceX employees have called CEO Elon Musk's behaviour a "distraction and embarrassment". The letter read, "Elon's behaviour in the public sphere is a frequent source of distraction and embarrassment for us...Every tweet that Elon sends is a de facto public statement by the company...SpaceX must...separate itself from Elon's personal brand."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Apple store workers in Maryland vote to form their 1st union in US
text: Majority of workers at an Apple store in Maryland have voted to unionise, a first for Apple in the United States. This comes after a group of employees called AppleCORE (Coalition of Organized Retail Employees) campaigned for unionisation. Notably, this is the third Apple store to launch a union drive this year, but the first to successfully hold a vote.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Which are India's 10 most valuable unlisted companies as per Hurun?
text: The National Stock Exchange of India is India's most valuable unlisted company with ₹2.28 lakh crore value, as per Burgundy Private Hurun India 500 report. It's followed by Serum Institute of India (₹1.75 lakh crore), BYJU'S (₹1.68 lakh crore), and Swiggy (₹81,800 crore). OYO, Dream11, Razorpay and Ola Cabs are among the top 10 most valuable unlisted companies in India.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: My father taught me a lot of engineering growing up: Musk on Father's Day
text: The world's richest person Elon Musk while replying to a Twitter user on the occasion of Father's Day, wrote, "He [his father] did teach me a lot of engineering and physics while growing up (in an environment that was austere and often bleak)." Musk was replying to the user who quoted his father, Errol, saying, "I was a strict father".
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar buys 1.7 lakh shares of company worth ₹11 crore
text: Paytm Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma has purchased 1.7 lakh shares of the company worth ₹11 crore, as per a regulatory filing. Sharma, being a selling shareholder in Paytm's IPO, wasn't allowed to buy shares for at least six months. He earlier said his stock grants will only be vested to him when Paytm's market capitalisation crosses IPO level.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Major edible oil brands reduce prices by up to ₹20 per litre
text: Major edible oil brands have announced they are slashing their MRPs by up to ₹20 per litre. Adani Wilmar has reduced the prices of Fortune oils by ₹10 per litre, whereas Mother Dairy has cut Dhara cooking oil prices by up to ₹15 per litre. Earlier this week, government reduced base import prices of crude palm oil and soy oil.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India's Russian coal purchases jump 6-fold in 20 days amid sanctions: Report
text: India's purchases of Russian coal have surged in the recent weeks despite Western sanctions on Moscow, according to data reviewed by Reuters. As per the report, traders are offering up to 30% discount and India's coal purchases increased over six-fold in the 20 days through May 27-June 15 while its oil trade with Russia jumped 31-fold in the same period.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: IKEA to cut jobs & put factories up for sale in Russia over Ukraine war
text: IKEA has announced that it will sell its factories, close its office and reduce its workforce of 15,000 employees in Russia following Moscow's invasion of Ukraine. It said that it will donate some of its stock to people in need. IKEA, which opened its first store in 2000, added that it will now start looking for buyers for its factories.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Reliance considers buying out Revlon in US after it files for bankruptcy: Report
text: Reliance Industries is considering buying out Revlon in the US after the 90-year-old cosmetics brand filed for bankruptcy earlier this week, ET NOW reported. Revlon has initiated Chapter 11 proceedings, known as reorganisation bankruptcy, to manage its multi-billion dollar debt. Shares of Revlon surged 60% in pre-market trading in US after the report, whereas Reliance stock closed 1.76% higher.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Last private lunch with billionaire Warren Buffett auctioned for record $19 million
text: The last private lunch with the world's eighth richest person and Berkshire Hathaway's Chairman Warren Buffett has been auctioned for $19 million. The winning bid broke the record set in 2019 by cryptocurrency entrepreneur Justin Sun, who paid $4.57 million to dine with Buffett. Proceeds from the auction will go to Glide Foundation, a charity which addresses poverty and homelessness.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Suggestions on digital-only bank came with risks, we've not accepted it: RBI Guv
text: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said the central bank received suggestions on digital-only banks, but it has not accepted them. "We felt that the idea came with certain risks...So we have...not accepted it at the moment," he explained. He further said there's no proposal on neobanks as the existing banks and NBFCs can adopt more technology for financial service delivery.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Wish I could welcome him back again: Mahindra shares pic with father on Father's Day
text: Businessman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share an old picture with his father on the occasion of Father's Day. He wrote, "As a child, it was...special to be allowed to go to the airport to see my father off...On Father's Day, I think of him and wish I could go to the airport again to welcome him back."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Twitter cancels Disneyland trip for employees in 2023 due to cost-cutting
text: Twitter has cancelled a company-wide trip to Disneyland planned for early 2023 in a cost-cutting measure amid buyout talks with Tesla CEO Elon Musk. The cancellation was reportedly confirmed hours before Musk's first meeting with employees on Thursday. "The reduction of travel and event costs allow us to operate in a more responsible and efficient manner," said a company spokesperson.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Tesla, Musk welcome to India only if policies are followed: Centre
text: Tesla and its CEO Elon Musk will be welcomed into India, only if they follow the policies of Atmanirbhar Bharat, Union Minister of Heavy Industries Mahendra Nath Pandey said. Praising the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, the minister said, "Aatmanirbhar Bharat policy received a very good response and we are not going to compromise on that in any way."
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Maruti Suzuki invests ₹2 cr in AI startup SocioGraph Solutions
text: India's largest automaker Maruti Suzuki has invested around ₹2 crore in AI startup SocioGraph Solutions. The investment is part of the company's MAIL initiative to support startups with promising mobility solutions. Maruti Suzuki plans to use SocioGraph's visual AI platform called Dave.AI, with an aim to enhance the digital sales experience of its customers.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: China accepts Ant's application for financial holding firm: Report
text: China's central bank has accepted Ant Group's application to set up a financial holding company, Reuters reported citing sources. This follows a period of a regulatory crackdown on Ant. Authorities had put Ant under revamp. China had derailed Ant's $37 billion IPO in 2020, following Alibaba Group being hit with a $2.75 billion antitrust penalty.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: US Federal Reserve hikes interest rates by 0.75%, biggest increase since 1994
text: The US Federal Reserve System on Wednesday raised its key interest rate by 0.75%, marking the biggest rate hike made by the US central bank since 1994. "The committee is strongly committed to returning inflation to its 2% objective," the bank's policy-setting committee said. The move will raise US Fed's benchmark short-term rate to a range of 1.5% to 1.75%.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Indians' funds in Swiss banks rise to 14-year high of over ₹30,000 crore
text: Funds parked by Indian individuals and firms in Swiss banks jumped to 14-year high of 3.83 billion Swiss francs (over ₹30,000 crore) in 2021 on sharp surge in holdings via securities and similar instruments, data showed. This includes funds parked through India-based branches and other financial institutions. Money in Indian customers' savings or deposit accounts rose to about ₹4,800 crore.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: WTO's fisheries deal initially opposed by India approved by all 164 members
text: After India opposed eliminating fisheries subsidies, on the fourth day of WTO's 12th ministerial conference in Geneva, the 164 members have now approved it. The WTO members reached the Fisheries Subsidies Agreement about nine years after the Ministerial conference of the WTO in Bali (2013). WTO members have also approved trade deals including pledges on food security and pandemic response.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Which are India's 10 most valuable companies as per Hurun list?
text: Reliance Industries with a value of ₹18,87,881 crore is India's most valuable company, according to Burgundy Private Hurun India 500- Special Report. It's followed by Tata Consultancy Services, HDFC Bank, Infosys, ICICI Bank, Adani Green Energy, Bharti Airtel, Housing Development Finance Corporation, Bajaj Finance and Kotak Mahindra Bank. The total value of these companies is ₹71.8 lakh crore.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: RBI lifts restrictions on Mastercard, allows onboarding of new domestic customers
text: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) said that it has lifted business restrictions imposed on Mastercard Asia/ Pacific Pte Ltd. RBI had restricted Mastercard from onboarding new domestic customers (debit, credit or prepaid) onto its card network. It had imposed the restrictions in July 2021 for failing to comply with norms related to 'Storage of Payment System Data'.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Which are the top 10 nations on World Competitiveness Index as India jumps 6 places?
text: Denmark has been ranked 1st on World Competitiveness Index released by International Institute for Management Development. Switzerland has been ranked second, followed by Singapore, Sweden, Hong Kong SAR, Netherlands, Taiwan, Finland, Norway and US. India has witnessed the sharpest rise among the Asian economies, with a six-position jump from 43rd to 37th rank.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Musk sued for $258 billion over alleged Dogecoin 'pyramid scheme'
text: A Dogecoin investor has filed ​​a $258 billion lawsuit against the world's richest man Elon Musk and his companies Tesla and SpaceX, accusing him of running a pyramid scheme to support the cryptocurrency. Keith Johnson claimed investors lost around $86 billion since Musk began promoting Dogecoin and is seeking to represent the people who lost money investing in it.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Musk arrived 10 mins late in video call with Twitter staff, sat in a kitchen: Report
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk reportedly dialled in 10 minutes late into the virtual meeting with Twitter employees on Thursday. As per another report, Musk appeared to be sitting in a kitchen and had logged into the meeting through his phone. Musk's internet connection was reportedly disruptive and his audio kept getting cut out at points during the meeting.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: DOGE founder shares 'death knocking' meme to suggest real estate crash, Musk says 'True'
text: Dogecoin Co-founder Billy Markus has suggested that real estate may be the next thing to collapse after stock and crypto markets. He posted a meme with death opening doors in turn and leaving pools of blood behind each of them. Tesla CEO and the world's richest man Elon Musk replied to the tweet by writing, "True."
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Costs exceeding revenue, firm needs to get healthy: Musk on job cuts at Twitter
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Thursday addressed Twitter employees for the first time. Responding to a question about future layoffs at the company, Musk replied, "The company does need to get healthy. Right now the costs exceed the revenue so that's not a great situation to be in...Anyone who is obviously a significant contributor should have nothing to worry about."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Exceptional employees can work from home: Musk in 1st meeting with Twitter staff
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Thursday held his first meeting with Twitter employees. Speaking about remote work, he said, "If someone can only work remotely, and they're exceptional, it wouldn't make sense to fire them...Bias definitely needs to be strongly toward working in person." Earlier, Musk reportedly told Tesla employees to work from the office or they can quit.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Crypto market value falls below $900 bn as Bitcoin drops to $20,000 level
text: The value of the global crypto market fell to under $900 billion on Wednesday from a peak of $2.97 trillion in November 2020. Bitcoin, the world's largest crypto by market capitalisation, also fell 7.8% to $20,289, its lowest value since December 2020. Bitcoin has dropped around 30% in value since Friday and lost over half of its value this year.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: ₹15.74 lakh crore of investors' wealth wiped out in 5 days as markets decline
text: Equity investors became poorer by ₹15.74 lakh crore in five days of market fall, where the BSE benchmark tumbled 1,045.60 points on Thursday, amid unabated foreign capital outflows, inflation concerns and weak global markets. In five trading days, the Sensex has dived 3,824.49 points or 6.91%. The BSE benchmark settled at 51,495.79, its fifth day of decline, on Thursday.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Sensex falls over 1,000 points to close at 51,496, Nifty drops to 15,360
text: BSE Sensex on Thursday dropped 1,045.60 points to 51,495.79 while Nifty fell 331.55 points to 15,360.60, both ending at fresh 52-week lows. Tata Steel, Coal India, Tata Motors, Oil and Natural Gas Corporation and Hindalco Industries were amongst the top Nifty losers. The shares of Nestle grew the most on Thursday, recording a 0.43% rise to ₹16,874/share.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: This is cute, I had no idea: PhonePe CEO on reports of company filing for IPO
text: Hours after reports came out that PhonePe is considering raising funds through an initial public offering (IPO), its Founder and CEO Sameer Nigam said he had no idea about it. "This is cute. I had no idea my own company is filing an IPO," he wrote. Reports said the company is seeking a valuation of $8-10 billion.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: 90-year-old cosmetics brand Revlon files for bankruptcy over multi-billion dollar debt
text: Cosmetics brand Revlon on Wednesday filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection over multi-billion dollar debt. The 90-year-old company has listed both assets and liabilities of as much as $10 billion, according to court papers. Chapter 11 bankruptcy provides a procedure by which an individual or business can reorganise its debts while continuing to operate.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Sensex, Nifty slip to their fresh 52-week lows; over 150 stocks touch 52-week low
text: Sensex on Thursday plunged to around 51,700, touching a fresh 52-week low.  Meanwhile, Nifty also touched its 52-week low and is trading at around 15,400. Over 150 stocks touched their 52-week low on the BSE, Moneycontrol reported. These included Wipro, UCO Bank, Tata Steel, RBL Bank, NBCC and Just Dial.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Musk to reiterate desire to own Twitter in meeting with staff: WSJ
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk will reiterate his desire to own Twitter in the meeting with the platform's employees today, the WSJ reported. He may also clarify his statements about remote work and talk about his strategy for Twitter, covering advertising and subscriptions. Earlier, Musk said Tesla employees needed to be in the office for at least 40 hours per week.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Unemployment rate drops to 8.2% in January-March 2022: NSO survey
text: Unemployment rate for persons aged 15 years and above in urban areas has dipped to 8.2% in January-March 2022, according to the National Statistical Office's (NSO) 14th Periodic Labour Force Survey. Unemployment rate among females in urban areas aged 15 years and above declined to 10.1% while for males, it declined to 7.7%. Unemployment rate in January-March 2021 was 9.3%.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Agro firm's CFO arrested for cheating investor of ₹117 cr in Mumbai
text: Agro firm Suumaya Industries' 28-year-old Chief Financial Officer (CFO) Dhwani Paresh Dattani was arrested for allegedly cheating an investor of ₹117 crore, an official said on Thursday. Dattani was arrested on Tuesday by the Mumbai Police's Economic Offences Wing based on evidence collected under an ongoing investigation, the official added. She had promised the investor of high returns.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Kotak Mahindra Bank hikes minimum lending rate for June by 20-25 bps
text: Private lender Kotak Mahindra Bank on Thursday raised its marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) for June by 20-25 basis points (bps). The bank has also hiked its one-year MCLR by 20 bps to 7.85%. The bank had increased the lending rate by five bps to 7.25% in January and continued to raise it by five bps till April.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Jet fuel price at all-time high after seeing steepest-ever hike of 16%
text: Price of jet fuel, or aviation turbine fuel (ATF), in Delhi hit an all-time high of ₹1,41,232.87/kilolitre after it witnessed the steepest-ever hike of 16.26% on Thursday. ATF prices have risen 91% in 2022's first six months. A minimum 10-15% increase in air fares is required to ensure cost of operations are better sustained, said SpiceJet MD Ajay Singh.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Bank of England raises interest rates to 1.25%, warns of steeper hikes
text: Bank of England hiked interest rates for a fifth consecutive meeting on Thursday, increasing it by 25 basis points to 1.25%, its highest level since 2009. Policymakers led by Governor Andrew Bailey hinted they may join a growing trend for steeper hikes if inflation continues to soar. The Bank also raised this year's peak inflation forecast to "slightly above" 11%.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India better placed than many economies to avoid stagflation: RBI article
text: An article published in Reserve Bank of India's June bulletin has said that India is better placed than many other countries to avoid the risks of a potential stagflation. The article noted that global economic conditions continue to deteriorate as rising commodity prices and market volatility have led to heightened uncertainty. Domestic economic activity is gaining strength, it further said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: LinkedIn, UN Women partner to advance women empowerment in India
text: LinkedIn on Wednesday announced partnership with United Nations Women to advance women's economic empowerment in Asia Pacific, beginning with the state of Maharashtra. The LINK Women Project will begin with a 15-month pilot to cultivate the digital, soft and employability skills of 2,000 women. Women who have completed higher education can participate in the project.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India's trade deficit in May at record $24.3 bn, exports rise 20.55%
text: India's merchandise exports in May rose 20.55% to $38.94 billion while the trade deficit rose to a record $24.29 billion, up from $6.53 billion recorded in May 2021, according to government data released on Wednesday.  Imports in May grew 62.83% to $63.22 billion. Cumulative exports and imports between April 2022-May 2023 rose to $78.72 billion and $123.41 billion respectively.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Risk of US recession probably at 50% now: Morgan Stanley CEO
text: The risk of a recession in the US is at about 50%, said Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman. An economic downturn could "fatally damage" some institutions, Gorman said and added that any such decline would likely be short-lived. My focus in more on non-financial risks like data stability, cyber and operations risk, he further said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India opposes WTO's global deal to eliminate fisheries subsidies
text: India has opposed WTO's global deal to eliminate fisheries subsidies. Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal said India doesn't operate huge fishing fleets to exploit the resources indiscriminately. Goyal added that India wants to protect subsidies to poor traditional fishermen. The WTO operates on the basis of consensus decision-making, meaning any one member’s veto can scrap agreements.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: India's wholesale inflation rises to record 15.88% in May as against 15.08% in Apr
text: India’s Wholesale Price Index (WPI) surged to a record high of 15.88% in May, up from 15.08% in April, data released by the government showed. The WPI inflation was 13.11% in May 2021. The Ministry of Commerce and Industry attributed the high inflation in May to a rise in "prices of mineral oils, crude petroleum and food articles", among others.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: UAE bans export of Indian wheat till September
text: The UAE has imposed a moratorium on the export and re-export of wheat and wheat flour from India for four months starting from May 13. The UAE said this decision comes in view of international developments that have affected trade flows and in appreciation of the strategic relations after India's approval to export wheat to the UAE for domestic consumption.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: SBI hikes lending rate by 0.2%, EMIs to go up
text: India's biggest lender State Bank of India (SBI) has hiked the marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by 20 basis points, or 0.2%, across all loan tenors. Since consumer loans like home loans and car loans are linked with MCLR, EMIs will go up with the increase in lending rate. The new rates come into effect from June 15.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Air India's acquisition of AirAsia India approved by CCI
text: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) on Tuesday approved Tata Sons-owned Air India's proposal to acquire entire shareholding in AirAsia India. Prior to the acquisition, Tata Sons held a majority shareholding of 83.67% in AirAsia India, while the remaining stake was owned by AirAsia Investment Ltd (AAIL), part of Malaysia's AirAsia Group. Air India proposed to acquire AirAsia in April.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Crypto firm BlockFi to fire 20% staff, CEO cites 'macroeconomic conditions'
text: Cryptocurrency firm BlockFi on Monday announced that it will fire 20% of its 850 employees and that the job cuts will impact every team in the company. CEO Zac Prince while sharing a Twitter thread about it wrote, "We’ve been impacted by the dramatic shift in macroeconomic conditions", and this was not a "decision taken lightly".
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Coinbase fires 1,100 employees, CEO says 'we appear to be entering recession'
text: Coinbase is laying off 18% of its workforce, or about 1,100 employees citing "economic downturn", amid a collapse in its stock and crypto prices. The crypto exchange's CEO Brian Armstrong told employees, "We appear to be entering a recession after a 10+ year economic boom." Earlier this month, Coinbase extended its hiring freeze and rescinded a number of accepted offers.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: 7 crypto billionaires' combined wealth falls to $31 bn from $145 bn in 7 months
text: The combined net worth of seven crypto billionaires has plunged from a peak of $145 billion in November 2021 to $31 billion, as per Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao witnessed the biggest decline, with his net worth plunging from a high of $95.8 billion to $10.2 billion. Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong's wealth fell $11.6 billion during this period.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tesla fires its top Singapore executive after Musk warned of 10% job cuts
text: Tesla has fired its Singapore country manager, who had joined the company a year ago. Christopher Bousigues shared a LinkedIn post and wrote, "Proud to have been Tesla's first country manager in South East Asia". Earlier, Elon Musk in a leaked email said he would cut 10% of Tesla's workforce as he had a "super bad feeling" about the economy.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Tesla India policy executive quits after company puts India plan on hold: Report
text: Tesla's Policy and Business Development executive for India and new markets in South East Asia, Manuj Khurana, has resigned weeks after the carmaker put on hold its plans to sell electric cars in the country, Reuters reported. Khurana was appointed to the role in March 2021 and was lobbying the Indian government to slash the import tax on electric cars.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: 5 billionaires including world's richest man Musk collectively lost $345 bn in 2022
text: Among the world’s richest people, five billionaires collectively lost $345 billion this year, according to Bloomberg Billionaires Index. While Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao lost $85.6 billion in 2022 so far, he is followed by the world’s richest man Elon Musk, whose wealth declined by $73.2 billion. The world's 500 wealthiest people have collectively lost $1.4 trillion this year.
